reviews.content: I saw Brazen was trending on Netflix so I gave it a shot. Bad idea. I can't believe I actually sat through that. What a waste of time. Even Hallmark makes better movies. I have no idea how this is the 2nd most watched movie on Netflix right now. 3 stars.

reviews.review_title: The twist is that there is no twist
reviews.content: Fourteen minutes in, you suspect a problem character and so throughout the movie you are saying to yourself that this character cannot possibly be the villain, as it is so obvious. You hope for some big twist at the end to redeem this long insufferable movie, but alas, there is no such twist. The plot is a joke, and most of the acting is wooden, especially by the detective and the sister. With an instantly recognizable brand, from her childhood days to being the "inventor" of #metoo in modern times, Alyssa Milano is used as the big draw for this, and mostly she succeeds. She is no Jennifer Lawrence but she is a decent actress. Give credit where credit is due. She is truly the only thing that makes this remotely watchable.

Absolutely dreadful. Felt like I was watching an old 80's Lifetime movie. It's like it was only made to show off Alyssa's boobs. And if that is what Nora Roberts books are like, count me out. Doesn't seem like I'm missing much. Skip this one, don't waste your time. There wasn't one moment of suspense.

I can't believe I sat through the whole movie. Everything about it was so fake. I didn't see characters, I saw actors playing a part, reading lines, repeating scenes over and over again. The story itself could have been interesting but the acting and especially the dialogue were so bad! Alyssa Milano looks awful in this movie. Terrible performance on her part, really. The chemistry between her and Sam Page didn't feel right either. Too many scenes were repetitive (and redundant). Some were just happening for the sake of the story, like the part where Grace is becoming a consultant (I mean, come on!). Everything about this movie was really fake. Nothing felt authentic, not the love, not the anger, not the sadness, not even the so called "revelations". It was so stiff, nothing was fluent. Do yourself a favor and skip this one. Or maybe read the book. I haven't read it but it's got to be better than this. Another failed Netflix production, but what else is new?!
Milano just wanted to wear the leather dominatrix suit. Other than that, it seemed like a poor adaptation of what would've been a great novel. Hallmark.

reviews.review_title: Not a bright spot for Alyssa Milano
reviews.content: Alyssa Milano is a pretty good actress, when she puts herself into a role. But here seems like she doesn't really want to be in this, her performance seems like she just did this movie has a favor. And Sam Page who plays the detective who is helping her, his performance seems like he is uncomfortable being in a scene with her.Now there are some good moments of suspense. But other than that the movie itself has no entertaining mystery like feel to it, like Scream did, makes me feel I'd rather be watching that instead. I began to lose interest on where it was going.

This film premiered on Netflix a few days ago so I decided to watch Brazen and here is my review for it. The premise of the film sees after a tragedy, an author who is an expert in murder mysteries aids the police in their attempts to find a killer.Main Character
Alyssa Milano plays the lead character in this film and she is just really bad here. Lets face it the most famous thing she is known for these days is the fact that the ship in Guardians of The Galaxy is named after her not her current acting ability. She overacts throughout and her character is so infuriating and annoying to watch, she always thinks she is better then everybody else in the film and it comes off as pretentious.Supporting Characters
The cast is small and unremarkable with their characters. The main one is the main detective played by Sam Page, the two of them are meant to have chemistry but they really don't and it kills this film. He is written badly and feels like a weak character despite the fact that he is meant to be the best detective they have which is laughable. The rest of the characters add little value and I just didn't care about anybody in this film and that was a big let down.Story
The story at least has a bit of intrigue to it, the best thing I can say is that I slightly enjoyed watching the investigation into the case and how it links to together with other elements of the film. Unfortunately, though I worked out what was going on pretty quickly which made the reveal feel lacklustre to me.Script
The script is bad, it does nothing to make itself too imaginative or creative. It is filled with a bunch of clichés with none of it working. The romance and humour fails and the drama overall misses the mark in my opinion.Style
The film has some pretty good action sequences and I thought they did an effective job of showing this killer going after these woman, so that was one aspect that was handled well. But the film struggles with its pacing and really rushes the final act, the film also ends so abruptly that the film fails to explain what really happened and it makes you really wonder why you bothered.Overall
Overall, Brazen is another awful Netflix film that should be avoided at all cost. Netflix make quality programming but they really have to improve some of these original films that are just rubbish.Rating - 2/10.

reviews.review_title: I can't get the time back
reviews.content: I can't believe Netflix are producing this Hallmark type film which is pretty bad. Actually it could have been a lot more edgy. The highlight was watching Grace in her dominatrix outfit at the end. I do hope they don't make a follow up.

reviews.review_title: So Netflix is adding "made for TV" movies?
reviews.content: Terrible movie. Terrible writing, acting, pacing. Milano should really just ride the little fame she has from her childhood years and let it be because she's not a good actor. So knowing that, I didn't expect much but it was even worse than imagined. But if you've really nothing better to do, give this movie a shot. You might like it better than I did, but I won't bet on that.

Movies in the 70s and 80s would have acting and Direction like this. It's extremely difficult to understand how such a terrible film even got approved for funding.Save your time and leave this terrible film the Netflix libraries.

Undoubtedly the worst detective, suspense thriller I have ever seen. The storyline was poor, the direction was poor, the script was poor, the acting was poor - another Netflix flop!Avoid, avoid, avoid.

The only word I can think of to describe this film is: moist. Due to the subject matter and themes, this film should have been darker and many avenues could have been taken with it, but it reminded me of those basic thrillers you see on Lifetime (or Channel 5 in the UK). So many more twists could have been thrown in. I expect better from Netflix. It didn't have enough suspects, and so it was quite predictable and a little flaccid. I do like Alyssa Milano however, I think she's a good actress and this film was really a waste of her talent. I see it was based on a book which I've not read, so I'm unable to make comparisons, but the book has to be better than the movie, right?

Brazen is a Netflix movie about a famous murder mystery writer played by Alyssa Milano who moves back home only to face a murder close to her family. A serial killer who kills dominatrix girls and one of them ends up being Milan's sister. The story was very clumsy, I solved who the killer would be in the first ten minutes of the movie. Sam Page who always portrays the love interest in most of the Hallmark Christmas movies is the badass cop, next door neighbor who falls in love with Milano. This was such a B rated movie that I couldn't wait for it to end. Skip this one, don't waste your time.

This was TERRIBLE. Who wrote this script?! Why did these actors decide to act in it?Honestly this movie was so cringe and weird. The timings of certain dialogue was off. There is no plot twist, no suspense, nothing worth watching.

First, I want to say it's very unfair that so many of the negative reviews for this movie are based on the lead actor's personal politics, because the reality is this movie deserves to be judged on just how truly awful it is and we can also be pretty sure the people who hate Milano didn't watch the movie to begin with.What this movie does is give some wooden acting and cheap production and direction to an already cliched and unoriginal story by a pretty mediocre romance novelist. Everything about this plot is cookie cutter. I had to hold back the laughter when Grace was talking to the detectives and said one of the suspects was her former brother-in-law, Jonathan Breezewood "the third." "He's a bigshot attorney," Grace said. Keep in mind, this character is supposed to be a famous author herself. What self-respecting writer would use such a hackneyed phrase?So the murdered sister was a teacher who had a secret second job as a webcam model. Gee, how original. And her ex-husband whom she was in a custody battle with was a suspect. Again, snore. And then of course one of her students who was a slightly awkward literature nerd happened to have a special interest in her. Is this a movie script or a mad libs exercise?One of my favorite scenes (before I got too bored to keep watching) was when the detectives went to visit the corporate office of the website she was modeling on and meet with the CEO to ask questions about her clients. First, let's acknowledge how stupid it is that the OnlyFans-like website she was using just happens to be headquartered in the same town she lived in. Now add on how stupid it is that detectives would talk to a corporate executive to try to get information about who the woman's subscribers (which the movie calls clients) were. This is simply not how an investigation like this would work at all in the real world. They would most likely have to subpoena that information or at the very least get it from a low-level security employee, not the CEO. It's how a very simple-minded or purely unmotivated person would write it though. And the best part of the scene is that the CEO's office walls are covered in giant TVs that are supposed to be showing a bunch of different models live streaming, but if you look for even a second you'll realize all the screens are showing the same 10-second loops over and over again. Do they really think the CEO of OnlyFans has dozens of screens streaming porn going on at all times in their office?I rarely stop a movie after I've started it, but this one was just trash. It doesn't even have the cheesy, campy entertainment factor of similar Lifetime and Hallmark movies. It's just a dreary, stupid, pointless waste of time.

I can't even call this movie bad that's a compliment it's such pure drivel there is no plot the actors? Wooden isn't even an adjective for them IDK Netflix keeps on getting worse and worse and they spend so much money on a lot of this I don't get it but Really in the past two weeks except for a rare exception of the ones that win awards 1 or 2 a year the rest is really really getting bad oh btw I understand Now why Alyssa Milano when she makes her remarks on Twitter is always asked who need your opinion you can't even master your own profession?? Awful.

In this movie what at first, I thought it was a comedy, a police detective and a book writer date each other and compete who will find the killer of her sister. The writer's book must be as lousy as Brazen's script, as discussed at their first date. Anyhow, the killer is pretty obvious from the beginning, but it takes a whole movie for them to find out. Funnily enough, the police captain allows the random writer to participate to the police investigations.Actually, it is a very good movie (hence the 3 stars) to put on the background when you do something else, as you can check it out anytime and you haven't missed anything (as I said, you probably know the killer from the first 15 minutes).

reviews.review_title: Jumping in front of a train would be better than watching this.
reviews.content: Seriously - I'd rather get hit by a train than watch this garbage. The only reason this got watched in the first place is because of the snow storm that came through. I should of known better..... please do anything else with your time..... go watch grass grown or paint dry.... It will be so much more entertaining.

This movie is a complete failure from beginning to end. The adaptation is bad. The directing is bad. The acting is bad. Not sure any actor could have made this better but Milano's acting was super bad. The money spent on this movie could have well went to a more worthy cause. Netflix certainly won't win any good recognition. With this one.

I really do like Alyssa Milano. And I say that although I am not always agreeing on what or how she says things in public. That being said, everyone is entitled to their opinion and it would be mad if we all thought and felt the same.The acting is ok I reckon, but the movie is as predictable as they come. Alyssa plays someone close to her heart, powerful, driven and woke - as in fighting inequality and all that jazz. Now that is more than a noble cause and her character is one that we should celebrate I suppose ... yet, she comes off as annoying to most and even when she has the upper hand and should be superior (against an "evil" man) ... he is almost more sympathetic than she is ... which is insane considering he is painted as bad Dude.Anyway, the movie has quite a few cliches, tries to be sizzling too, but never achieves any goals it sets out to do.

reviews.review_title: Not that different from your average lifetime thriller
reviews.content: This movie has convinced me that Netflix lies about who gets on their top 10 list. This movie has a terrible plot and mediocre cast- your average lifetime movie is 10x better. Don't watch unless you're looking for mess.

Now we understand why Netflix increased subscription rates.Overall the best part of the film is the cherry blossoms.Overall we can easily rate cast script acting stupidity waste of money talentlessness costumes hair all on the same level - so consistency is it's redeeming feature.May I suggest you don't attempt to compare it with Gone With The Wind Casablanca Some Like It Hot or any Hitchcock filmFor film students a lesson in not what to make what to avoid and the ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: Come on. It's not that bad as it is in most reviews.
reviews.content: I know that my review is going to get many disagreements (down votes) but I'm going to say anyway because I want to write what I feel in honest way.Before I watched this film, I happened to read some of reviews and also the rating. Most of the reviews are saying that this film is totally bad and the rating is just 3.9 which is a bit lower than normal. So, I watched it to know how bad it is.After I watched it, I found out that it wasn't that bad after all. The story is kind of good. A little bit of mystery. But I must admit what some people were saying is right. The acting is kind of not that good. I feel like their acting is not sincere. It's like it's not coming from the heart, not serious. It's like they are not taking seriously. A little bit like child play. Just like that. But I've seen the worst. So, I think this kind of acting isn't that bad.It seems to me that this film is made with low budget. I'm not saying it's low budget because there aren't famous actors and all. I'm saying that it seemed to be low budget film. The quality is a bit low. So, if they've put more effort to it, it might turn out to be a good one.Right now, this film isn't a good one, but it isn't a bad one either. It's kind of enjoyable for one time watch.

One would think... having the acting record like Alyssa Milano has had (being the person who basically helped pioneer the #metoo movement on Twitter too btw), that would surely help put her in better films than this... apparently I'm wrong.I found this to be another Netflix "Hallmark-y"-type drama that had no point whatsoever in making except to give those involved a paycheck.HORRIBLE ending. So basically... all is JUST FINE after KILLING a TEENAGER?! No follow up after that AT ALL?!? I can't you guys, I just can't.Nora Roberts is a decent writer for fans of this genre but I hope she didn't help green-light this dumpster-fire of a film. VERY disappointed.

Much worse as an actress. Yes, the movie is dumb.But figured with Milano in it, it would be watchable.Wrong. I have seen first time actresses in horror movies perform better .Time for Milano to retire. Dam that was a terrible
job.

reviews.review_title: I would have got away with it too...
reviews.content:
A genuinely awful film. Plot holes so wide you could float a container ship through them. Acting that belongs in the local am-dram group. A police captain that could only have become captain. B
ecause they are in charge of the most inept group of law enforcement officers. Really Netflix. How on earth did this ever make on to your platform. There's some utter junk on there but this is a the bottom holding the rest up. There are episodes of Scooby Doo that have a better plot and acting.

This is disappointing to watch. We've watched a lot of films featuring Alyssa Milano. And these are good ones while Alyssa is a competent actress. So, watching this film was an unpleasant surprise. The plot is predictable and it lacks that certain oomp and excitement that you'd normally expect from a good thriller or a police procedural. And that love story between Grace and Ed seems so campy. At least, Melachi Nair as Ben made me smile. He's subtly funny in his role as police detective.

reviews.review_title: Milano a weight, not an anchor
reviews.content: Brazen is a load of hot garbage. Almost everything about it is second or third rate, from the script to the story to the acting.Unfortunately, there are too many plot holes and inconsistencies -- and too much stupidity -- for this to be a work of any significance, and the writers bring nothing new to the table whatsoever. Literally every element of this story has been done, done, and done again. No twists, no reversals, no surprises means no excitement and no suspense.But that's not the worst of it. There's an elephant in the room that simply can't be overlooked: Alyssa Milano.While Milano wasn't any worse than anyone else in this movie (which doesn't mean she was good), she's problematic and hard to watch. Like most people, I am aware she's an activist whose convictions are extreme and ethics situational, and that her persona is caustic. While her politics shouldn't be relevant to the movie, the fact is we live in a world in which personal conduct has a bearing on professional reputation. It's no different for Milano. The fact that she's an all around unpleasant person is impossible to forget, and nothing about Brazen is strong enough to overcome that. The other reviews here are further indication she no longer has enough goodwill left to be viable in the entertainment industry, especially in the absence of a polished, deeply felt performance.All that said, the film sports decent production values. It's competently filmed with good framing and good color. The sound is decent as well. Unfortunately, there's nothing worthwhile here to amplify.

I have to say I knew, as I'm sure many others did, who the killer was the minute I saw him and even the red herrings the script threw at me did not change my opinion. That said, the road to that discovery was moderately suspenseful and the film held my attention throughout.

Where do I begin? This movie is like a bad lifetime movie. Acting was horrible . Characters acting ridiculous.. so many plot holes. For instance , how did the killer find the victims homes, never explained. What police department
Lets the victims sister investigate the case. I could go on and on. Do yourself a favor and skip this dud.

Very normal detective film that looks like an episode of a TV series, but still quite valid and very entertaining. The twists are well structured and the interactions between the characters are very well managed. Too bad that in the end it is very banal and without particular inspiration.
The worst thriller movie ever ,not worthy your time, its super predictable that youre going to feel super silly and stupid at the end, im checked that a movie that silly was produced in year 2021.

reviews.review_title: I expected more from a 2022 movie
reviews.content: Surprisingly bad acting, bad plot, loose ends and I want my 1h36m back. I haven't read it but I can guarantee that the book is better because this movie was a trainwreck.

I'll start with a positive - Alyssa Milano still looks amazing and has as much charisma and charm as always. Both her and the male lead (whoops forgot his name) were enjoyable to watch. The story itself is a very stock standard whodunnit and I personally had figured it all out long before any of the characters did. The script could use some work and a lot of the time the movie had that b grade made for tv feel.

A film designed entirely to simply fulfill the search request when you type in Alyssa Milano.A very predictable plot and some rather wooden performances makes this a skip. If you do watch, I'd suggest watching at 1.5x.Paint by numbers police mystery. The villain isn't even interesting.
I really am sad that Sam Page and Emilie Ullerup Are in this really terrible movie. I've seen them in other things and they were really good. Don't bother with this it's really awful.

This looks like it was based on an 'airport' paperback and feels more like a Sunday afternoon episode of Columbo or McMillan & Wife than a proper film. It is fairly predictable and lightweight and even the main characters are pretty thin with no real substance to give them life.

reviews.review_title: All Those 1 Star Raters Are Milano's Haters
reviews.content: Maybe I'm a little biased about Alyssa Milano, cause I'm a hardcore Charmed fan. But all of those 1 star raters called Alyssa Milano's acting sucks. Which is a blatant lie, clouded by their hatred towards her. They must really hate her guts! Jesus! Her acting hasn't dropped at all since her Charmed days. It's always good. I won't say it's amazing, since I'm not an actor, I don't know the criteria of amazing acting. But if it was lousy, even an amateur like me would've recognized it.With that being said about the main actress, I'll just point some weaknesses this movie has. The story is very simple, it's meant to be a mystery but turned out to be too simple for a complex crime story. The plot is too predictable. Within the first 15 minutes, I already could guess the culprit. The next 15 minutes, I knew for sure who the killer was. So there wasn't any real mystery in this movie. The Desiree part (Alyssa's Desiree) was meant to be sexy, but that fell short and looked kinda awkward. So if the objective was to turn on the audience, they failed to do so. And last but not least, the killing scenes were less intense than they were supposed to be. Maybe it's the director's lack on the action department. They should consult a fighting scene choreographer to make it more intense.But after taking all of these shortcomings, I still think that this movie is still watchable. It's a decent movie that doesn't deserve a 1 star rating. Don't believe all of those haters. If you need something to kill time with, you won't regret watching this flick.
Allyssa Milano is not an actress any more, she is an activist, because her acting skills are obviously non existent. So, i am "sorry, i am not sorry" this movie stinks.

reviews.review_title: A bit mystery, but overall full of boring conversation, and annoying overuse scene! Not recommended!
reviews.content: This film start with a man logging into his online account, and a woman shouting at the screen scene! As turnout, this film is about a novelist "Grace" need to use herself as a bait, to eventually found out who murder her sister "Kathleen"! The murderer actually is Kathleen's student "Jerald"! Entire film full of boring conversation, and annoying overuse scene! Such as, overuse of the walking scene, overuse of the searching scene, overuse of the arguing scene, overuse of the calling names scene, overuse of the staring scene, overuse of the drinking scene, overuse of the kissing scene, overuse of the talking on the phone scene, overuse of the long angle scenery scene, overuse of the shouting scene, and overuse of the interrogate scene! Make the film unwatchable! At the end, Jerald been killed after confronted with Grace! That's it! Wasting time to watch!

This is a really nice movie to watch during a cold night with popcorn and drinks. Not much expected from it. A well made movie with continuity, good acting and simple script.People rate this simple movie 3 or 4 with high expectation, but they gladly provide high rating to 'not so great' movies like Eternals or No Time To Die, which should have high expectations.

reviews.review_title: Looks and feels like a 90s television movie...
reviews.content: ...and it is not all that bad.I'm reading reviews that says that it is not a 2022 movie, and it certainly isn't. It's filmed and scripted as a 1990s television crime fiction, and it does its job fairly well. Alyssa Milano's performance is capturing. Detective story is simple but okay. Filming locations are old school to the extreme. Dominatrix themes... well, you might enjoy the looks.This movie is far from perfect, but it's made for nostalgia, and should be treated as such. It's good to relax and it's good to fall asleep to. Netflix should have things like that in its portfolio.

reviews.review_title: It was like a child's play
reviews.content: The acting was horrible. The direction was pathetic. There was not one intelligent moment in the entire film. The dialogues were laughable. This was one of the worst movies I've watched in years. This was so low production that it should never be released on Netflix. If this is going to be the standard, it's time for me to cancel my subscription.P. S. I've never watched anything with Alyssa Milano before, but whoever cast her in this role was crazy in the head as watching her in that costume made my head hurt.
I would like to say something positive about this movie, but I can't think of anything. No real surprises or twists in this movie, and the acting was lack luster. It very little sense at all.

Begin with a great Nora Roberta mystery. Add in a bad scriptwriter, fuzzy directing, and so so acting and you have tepid results. I feel Netflix could have done better by this new Alyssa Milano vehicle but not exactly sure what went wrong here and who's feet to lay blame. Maybe crunching in the book's timelines so everything moved too fast to be believable in movie world? Ex: her sister killed day after she moves in and she has also already met the detective living next door who'll be assigned to the case. So it was ok for a Thursday evening movie find, but definitely not something you'd look forward to.

This movie manages to create a bit of mystery, but the story has a lot of unnecessary stuff.This story has too many things, such as the relationship between the protagonist and the detective, which does not lead us anywhere, neither the romance nor the fights or disagreements that they have between them contribute anything to the story, the character development is poor, the outcome is predictable but because of the good performance of the antagonist, from the beginning you know that he is the bad guy but because of the actor's performance. The other performances are not good, there are too many characters, there are conveniences that help the plot continue, the action scenes are not good, but the mystery of the investigation is effective and the atmosphere created is convincing, and the jumps from one scene to another creating holes in the script are very unpleasant.I think it's a movie that knows it's bad and has a lot to prove it, but the mystery about the murder and the investigation is convincing to me and that saves the movie a bit.

If only Alyssa Milano could be as believable as she was in her but role as a runaway, homeless, teenage prostitute in Where the Day Takes You. This was just as bad as Poison Ivy 2. Don't come here looking to be swept up in some incredible story with exceptional acting. Although Alyssa is exceptional....at being unlikable.

reviews.review_title: Garbage, classic linear TV movie plot
reviews.content: Looks/feels low budget. Not sure if it was necessary to give one of the cops a bad Einstein wig but it didn't add any cleverness to this plot.Was so predictable and boring. I even considered putting snooker on instead.

The acting sometimes try to save it but you can't do much with such a script but hey you have toxic feminity and woman splaininng everywhere. I am a woman and that was extremely cringe.Ah, yes, the killer was so obvious since the second scene he appeared.

Didn't have high hopes for this movie but gave it benefit of the doubt since it's released in 2022 and on Netflix!After the first 15 minutes, the movie becomes fairly predictable. The movie is filled with many cliché scenes and dialogues that just don't make any sense.Worth a watch if it's been a while since you've got the killer in a whodunnit movie.

It's always a toss-up with these Made-for-TV movies on which is worse, the script or the acting.THE ACTING makes this movie a 1. The script might be less stars.Netflix must be desperate for ANYTHING to fill time-slots when they throw this on the air.... What's even more comical (or pathetic) is that this sophomoric attempt at movie-making is "trending" in the top-10 on Netflix.Our society is doomed.

reviews.review_title: Might be the worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: I can't believe why any production have okayed this movie.Acting: bad. Filming: bad. Story/plot: full of holes and terrible writing.Thats about 90 min of my life, I'll never get back😬

What could have been a great thriller with a actual truth to it ended up being one of the worse movies ever.The acting was not even worthy of a sitcom everything seemed forced not real to many exaggerations over acting .The dialogs where to simple no depth in the movie the editing i mean come on they went from getting to know each other to can't be without you in my life in like 5 scenes lollong story short not worth your time !

I cant believe that I wasted 1.5 hours of my life, hoping that there is somewhere in this movie an interesting plot twist.No. Nothing. Boring, stupid, bad acting.I would like to know who takes the decision to film such bad movies. The should quit the industry and never work there again.Did they pay someone to write the script? Seriously?HIRE ME! I can do SO MUCH better.

Didn't make it passed 12 minutes...
Of course a thriller with a "risque" start to it...
Not sure where where this is going, but I refused to waste more than 12 minutes on it.

Nothing exciting about the movie, it was okay, it passed the time, Alyssa Milano looked great in the movie. I chose to watch this movie because it was in the top 10 to watch on Netflix. 3/10 the movie really was mediocre.

reviews.review_title: Just horrible - great story.. too bad
reviews.content: Milano was terrible, the acting was as bad as all those lifetime/hallmark movies.... i really liked the story, so i stuck with it to see what happened, not sure who cast her in this, but anyone would have been better....

reviews.review_title: TV movie with reasonable story and good acting
reviews.content: I watched it, was fairly entertained by it. I hadn't looked at the two reviews before I watched it. If it had been only one or two stars I would not have lasted long. There weren't any great surprises or edge of the seat stuff but it was okay. Maybe people wanted the usual chases or big laughs. Acting was fine. I recognised the female lead and noted she has not changed much over the years. I liked her in the sitcom when she was a child. It wasn't 007 or any big bucks movie so it can't be graded as though it was. I didn't need to be shocked or want a fast paced movie suitable for the big screen. It is a TV movie. Maybe the script could have been better so it was different from many other movies of this genre. Being based on a book they may have followed that story line. Did I want to keep watching? Yes I did. Don't have high expectations and you should enjoy it. I think we have become very spoilt with the big screen, modern technology, etc. It satisfied me for a late night movie, not too heavy with no depressing ending.

reviews.review_title: Makes for an underwhelming murder mystery
reviews.content: Based on Nora Roberts' bestselling novel by the name "Brazen Virtue" that hit the shelves in May 1988, the Netflix film "Brazen" deals with the dark side of desire and is a story about serial killing. Grace Miller (Alyssa Milano) is a popular author of psychological thrillers and murder mysteries, enjoying the publicity of her latest novel when she is summoned by her younger sister Kathleen. Visiting their family home where Kathleen lives, Grace discovers that her sister is going through a messy divorce and barely makes enough to survive as a school teacher. She barely has had enough time to understand the mental condition of Kathleen, when a shocking tragedy strikes her - Grace returns home after a date with Kathleen's neighbour DC Ed Jennings (Sam Page) to find Kathleen brutally murdered. More surprise awaits her as she discovers soon that Kathleen was leading a double life, as she worked for an online pornography site.She won't suffer silently and watch the police chug along cluelessly to find her sister's assasin and virtually bulldozes her way into the police department, seeking to help Ed track down the potential suspects. And yet, there's another murder, almost similar in attributes. Both the victims worked for the same online site and acted as dominatrix. Both the deadbodies were left in a particular pose. Ed isn't pleased with Grace's intrusive ploy in spite of their romantic liaison as he finds it difficult to draw the line between his professional and personal life."Brazen" is an ordinary murder mystery by the current standards where there's no dearth of such thrillers either in the print media or as motion pictures. Perhaps its adaptation of a vintage bestseller is far too delayed to make an impression now. We need to appreciate that the novel first surfaced almost three and a half decades back when the concept could have created shock waves and evoked die-hard excitement but is considered passe today. The film is like a hundred such stories we have seen or read in the past twenty years with the suspense rather flat and the climax rather underwhelming.

It's not awful, it's not great. No surprises there considering the plot. You watch out of curiosity. It's Milano afterall. Too much makeup once again in American movies. Movies fill up a Saturday evening when it's cold outside.

reviews.review_title: I would give it a 0 if I could...
reviews.content: This has been a waste of 1.5 hours... The story is in shambles, the acting is non-existent and Milano (as expected) had to have her boobs out at some point... It was cringe-worthy and truly unwatchable. Save yourself the discomfort.

3 stars because people worked on this production and the cop partner made me laugh every time I saw his face. As for the rest, I've rarely seen such a bad movie with such bad actors. Oh boy this is really bad.

Monika Mitchell's 'Brazen' is one of those terrible movies. A colossal letdown in every aspect, there isn't a single part of the movie where it thrives or even performs a commendable job. There's no emotional connection with any characters, the dialogue is clumsy and stilted, and the murder-mystery narrative lacks tension. Cheesy and predictable.
OK... My sister has just been murdered, but I solve the case, I forget about my sweet little nephew and I only think about my new romance with the detective of the case ... All very credible.

I have lived Alyssa Milano since I was kid so I was happy to watch. This felt like a lifetime movie. But it wasn't bad. It's perfect for a night when you watch something without being over stimulated.

reviews.review_title: I give it a 5 on the Lifetime movie scale
reviews.content: I never want to see Alyssa Milano in a dom outfit ever again, please and thank you. The movie was ok but forgettable. I couldn't figure out the vibe between the sisters. It seemed as if Grace hated her in the beginning. This is a B or C movie for sure. For Netflix to be raising their prices again they are going to have to do much better than these types of movies.

Actually I said it all in the title but it has to be at least 150 characters so Ill stretch it: cliché story, not too great acting, pretty predictable, good enough if you have nothing else to do but in all it's nothing much.

I don't know the actress but blackfacing is deeply offensive and she is a bland actor.The soap style made for DVD, TV banal bland "film" is offensive in its own way.It's a pile of you-know-what.It has no suspense, it's obvious, it's predictable, it's badly acted. The characters are 1 dimensional cardboard cut-outs that you don't care about.It's the sort of drivel used in throwaway paperbacks of old.Just to spoil it. The weird student son of the senator did it.

Gave it a chance and it was awful. I was so bored waiting for something of interest to happen and nothing. Alyssa Milano cannot act. She was so dull and acts robotic in front of the camera. I wonder if her constant covid symptoms affected her ability to memorize her lines? She's the absolute worst part of this film. The 'plot' was laughable and what a complete waste of time.

I have not read this book. If the movie is like the book I don't understand why it's popular. Everything from the way the sisters act to the way the cops are. Just it's mind numbing. You know who the killer is the first time he talks to Kate and refers to his teacher by her first name. Red flag. Seriously, the way the relationship with the two leads is developed is not realistic. The police know the killer is targeting specific women from a specific site that they have the names too. Nope not going to warn any of them. Just no. I guess that I thought it would be an actual thriller. I have honestly seen lifetime movies with more realistic plots.

From
The begin this movie was awful. Felt I'm watching a real bad lifetime or hallmark movie. Very bad acting , Milano is horribly annoying and unlikable.Stupid storyline
Waste of time. Couldn't finish it
No clue why Netflix has it as top rated most watched
Makes me think it's all a farce.
Acting is so awful of all actors...I thought at least Alysa should be better?Writing is the same level bad, some scenes were so cringy I just skip it.

This is probably the worst movie I've ever watched. The script is terrible, plagued with cringey cliches and extremely predictable. The acting is awful on every single scene. The movie also tries to mix romance, comedy and thriller genres with the result being a hot mess.You can tell who is the killer as soon as he appears on screen for the first time. His character is on top of that boring and not interesting at all.The characters throw cheesy jokes and are happy instead of being worried and traumatized by a serial killer on the loose. Specially the main character whom her sister was just murdered and is deeply in love on the following scene where they just killed a psychopath teenager LOL.Plot holes are also consistent and infuriating all over the place. I was constantly shocked on how this ended up in Netflix and in my recommended section. Do not waste your time.

I saw a lot of people bashing this on Nora Roberts Wedsite before it was released. Solely on Alyssa Milano being cast to play the lead role. I'm sure that has a good deal of impact on the rating this movie has. It wasn't bad at all. I didn't love the premise but the acting was just fine.

reviews.review_title: I only watched it because I wanted to see Alyssa Milano.
reviews.content: The only thing pretty about this movie is the pretty blooming tree marking the end of a really bad movie. I'm sorry...I wanted to like it. I actually just to see how Alyssa is holding up...have I bit a 125 characters yet???

reviews.review_title: Not Just Bad, Comically Bad. Felt Like a longer TV Series Episode.
reviews.content: The only thing brazen here was the decision to green light this. The horrible acting, writing, screenplay and TV cinematography tank this. I literally sighed after listening to the first couple exchanges of dialog. Things did not improve as this is well-worn plot concept of a murder novelist turned detective. The female protagonist of course inserts herself into the investigation of the murder of her sister who has a hidden secret with her part-time job....or activity. Will she hamper or hurt the investigation? No surprise to the plot but she ends up in a relationship with the lead detective; what drama or hinderance will that cause the investigation? Don't bother with this one unless you want to see Alissa Milano try to revive her career. I assume it is a revival as I haven't seen her in anything in years.

reviews.review_title: Why would you make such movie in 2022
reviews.content: The overall experience of this movie was so 1990's, I remember watching such movies which had low to none thrill or suspense in whole movie.This movie so so so predictable and there is nothing where viewer would get excited for a single second. So ignore watching this film.

Bad acting, bad plot, bad script. A proper waste of time. And just because "my review is too short" for publishing, I will just repeat how bad in every possible aspect the movie is. Thank you and do not watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: So poorly made and dull I thought it was a tv show
reviews.content: My wife put this on and I honestly thought it was a really poor quality sunset beach style tv show and she already watched the first episode, it acts like you are supposed to know the people you see. Then I thought this is a Milano vanity project as the detective is a sub for 50 shades of grey and was shocked to see she didn't write it and it's based on a book, must be a shockingly bad book. A detective meets Milano for one day and decided to solve a murder case with her, never heard of confidentiality. We switched it off after 30-40 min, one of the worst films I've seen in years and we just got through lockdowns thanks to covid so we have seen a lot.It's dull, it's badly acted, it makes zero sense and it's really poor quality, probably the same budget as a McDonald's happy meal.

I love Alissa Milano and she is the reason why I was interested in watching this movie, but the script and direction are so poor, that makes all actors look bad! There is nothing original regarding the story and I feel stupid watching it! Really now? Grace ask police to be part of the team and they say ok! Watching Barney the purple dinosaur would have entertain me more. The police guy is a casual relaxed guy behind a desk that does minimal and waits for Grace to state the obvious, I.e 'the killer wants control'...oh wow. ...and at the end he puts a beanie on and breaks a door something that's not consistent with his character in the rest of the movie! The other roles in the movie are more caricatures than anything else! The killer, who was so obvious goes back to the house of Desire, really now? He knew Grace. He had talked to her before and he was aware of the fact that she was working with the police! Nothing is smart about this movie is just a waste of time! If you are an actor and you need the money and is a Netflix production you take your risks...

I have Covid. I am on day 4 quarantining in the basement away from my family who are all fine. I have read 623 articles and watched 724 movies in that time. And, so... it's only natural that I would eventually have to watch Brazen.While I am extremely happy to say I am recovering from Covid, I just made myself incredibly sick after watching Brazenless.

What an awful movie, awful script, awful directing and even worse acting. The writing was shocking, full of terrible one liners and "current" themes. Felt like the most B rated movie I've ever seen. Used to live Alyssa Milano now she seems desperate, fake. Awful.

reviews.review_title: A great who done it murder mystery
reviews.content: Alyssa Milano & Sam Page were very good in this who done it murder mystery. Despite the low rating , my wife and I loved the movie. Highly recommend the film.

Why such low ratings come on its not a blockbuster movie, its a made for TV movie. If your expecting marvel type action sequence then don't watch this movie. There are some reviewers that will rate any movie with a low score.Why? Nobody knows.
Surely Alissa Milano has done plenty to her face and the acting was never been terrific.But the movie was not so bad as many people wrote here. It was watchable and I gave it a 6.

Terrible storyline, terrible script, terrible acting. Worst movie I have seen in a very long time. Random scenes, random conversations... as if a rich kid got an opportunity from their parent to burn money on trying to make a movie - while completely high... It's just so stupid that there are now words for it. Only watch it if you want to be outraged about how bad something can be... Even consecutive sentences make no sense or any logic. As if they were picked randomly from a hat... I would seriously like to know what was happening in the head of the writer and director.

At best BRAZEN is an average crime thriller with matching acting,direction and screenplay.The good part of the movie was that it was not boring. However it was a typical B Grade film
Worth only watching on OTT
5/10.

reviews.review_title: Couldn't get past Milano's frozen Botox face!
reviews.content: If I could give this a negative 10, I would. Horrible, boring, laughable attempt at a movie. How is this #1 on Netflix??? Because it's like watching a train wreck you can't look away from. Please lay off the Botox Alyssa.

reviews.review_title: Decent writing let down by acting
reviews.content: The writing is passable, even decent, however the acting leaves much to be desired.Sam Page tries valiantly to carry the movie however Alyssa Milano was either not interested in acting in this particular movie or has somehow lost her ability to portray a believable character. I usually like her but her performance in Brazen is atrocious.Not really worth the time there are better choices on Netflix.

What was I thinking trying to watch an Alyssa Milano movie (not that I have seen one before)? I kept hoping that it would get but, nope.Netflix movies and normally ok. But I really struggled with this one.

First off, I can't stand Alyssa Milano. She has that " I know better " Hollywood attitude I cannot stand..and she also Carrie's it in this movie. There is absolutely no talent in the whole movie. The writing is awful and predictable. The casting is terrible and the plot is neglectful. The culprit is obvious from the very beginning. This is a typical movie by formula and it belongs to the Lifetime channel, not in Prime Time or Netflix.Milano is of that age that she should play an actress with romantic inclinations , she should play a mom, not a dominatrix or a sexy writer. It doesn't suit her. I always have thought of her as a B actress for television. The fact that she turned into a liberal feminist activist turns me off even more.She should forget about acting and do something else...

reviews.review_title: It's SO bad. Like, who wrote this script.
reviews.content: The script is so bad, it makes it hard for everyone else to successfully do their job. Alyssa Milano can't save this dumpster fire. I honestly am amazed I finished the movie.

I usually enjoy Nora Roberts based films but this is predictable, stiff and cliche'.Not a good comeback vehicle for Ms. Milano who's
performance was barely plausible.Netflix needs to better filter films that are mailed to them (ha!)

The trailer is a little deceiving as it looks more thrilling than the actual plot. It is predictable. Acting is okay. For some reason in some parts I don't think this role suit Alyssa Milano. I do like her though that's why I watched this movie. I enjoyed Tempting Fate better for her.

Predictable plot, one-sided characters, and sub-par acting. Not bad for a straight to DVD release Lifetime movie I suppose, but unless you just want background noise while you work on chores, I'd turn on something else.

reviews.review_title: They killed off the wrong sister
reviews.content: This could have been good but for the miscasting of the lead actress. What were they thinking? Had they cast Milano as the teacher, switched the roles and made Ullerup the writer, this flick would have been watchable.Milano drags through every scene as if she's pulling along an over-packed four-suiter behand her. The possibility for a good characterization is there in the script and direction, but Milano can't seem to get out of her own way and just let the character out.The other disappointment, they didn't just telegraph the ending, they erected a neon-lit billboard illustrating 'who-dun-it' so early on, the ending was anticlimactic.Add to these deficiencies, there's zero chemistry between the leads. Take a pass on this one.

reviews.review_title: The reviews here were more entertaining than the movie!
reviews.content: I ended up watching the last half of this with my phone open to the IMDB app, simultaneously cracking up at both the reviews and the hilarious dialogue that wrapped up this "Lifetime Movie" on Netflix. This is TOTALLY the kind of movie my mother used to watch on a Friday night when I was a teenager in the 80s. I give it two stars for the laughs, though!So sorry to insult the people who made and acted in it (seriously... the guy from Billions did a good job and deserved better than this!), but the dialogue and much of the overacting/emoting (not to mention the "sexy" music) was honestly SO HILARIOUS at the end. Like, I am still laughing... hahaha! They should have just gone ahead and made it a spoof.You have been warned by me and others, but I recommend if you do decide to go ahead and watch this, bring friends and go Mystery Science Theater with it.

What an awful movie. This isn't even made for TV Hallmark bad. It's just bad. To think Netflix announces a price increase while this garbage is trending as their #1. All you need to know about Netflix.

reviews.review_title: A movie to watch while ironing
reviews.content: Requiring minimum mental capacity, predictable, not too much fun to distract you and burn something, no subtitles needed. Off course it's not first on my ironing-movies list, but it should do the work.

reviews.review_title: What is this doing on Netflix? It smacks of a cheap Hallmark Channel movie.
reviews.content: I won't give anything away about the story or any spoilers, but this smells like a cheap Hallmark Channel movie. Weak story, weak script, mostly unknown actors and weak acting, from everyone in the movie, and cheap production values. Is Netflix getting this desperate for content? Why oh why does Netflix come up with this trash. To stamp this a Netflix Original is embarrassing for Netflix. The most expensive thing about this movie is theta it is in Dolby Vision with Dolby ATMOS sound. Save yourself some time and pick something else, use the Netflix random option to pick something that will likely be something better.

I quickly gave this movie a watch after reading the description on Netflix and had somewhat high hopes. I notice the dominatrix girl (Emilie Ullerup) who was murdered has appeared in a lot of Hallmark movies. In my opinion, this movie wasn't much better than your average Hallmark movie. This movie had great potential as the story was actually pretty interesting, but halfway through the movie when they are trying to find the dominatrix murder seems a bit rushed to me. This film in my opinion was full of cheap suspense that tried to get you thinking there was a big twist. In this type of thriller the murderer is never the person you expect, but in this movie it was pretty obvious to narrow down a couple suspects who had to be the killer. I didn't give this movie a high rating at despite somewhat enjoying it. Overall, I can't really say I'd recommend this one.
It was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Most Netflix Movies really suck. The script, the acting, everything is a disgrace.It's a shame money wasted on this movie...

BrazenMy wife and I. We both have theatre background. And we're not about to launch into a boring six paragraph dissertation on any TV show or movie. We would like to think that our light-hearted, semi-non sequitur reviews based upon the silly MST3K model might be enjoyable for some. WE get a kick out of it ; ).8-stars. Everything starts with an 8-star rating.You know how you put your foot into the water before you jump in? My wife
thinks this is what Netflix is doing with this genre of movie.

reviews.review_title: Milano's Bad Acting Day + 10yo writers = middle school production
reviews.content: The irony of whoever let their niece or nephew write this is that they failed to notice or help the nepotism beneficiary in any way - and failed to notice the nepotism beneficiary's hubris in making the main character a hugely successful author...while the script "writer" didn't have the qualifications to write a made for tv movie. The "writer" should find a new profession, where writing dialog is not part of the job. The writing is THAT brutally awful, truly. The dialog throughout just gets harder and harder to watch.Milano should stick to TV, but...I remember her having SOME skills and in this, either it was intended as parody or she may actually have medical issues IRL. I hope she is OK, bc her acting in this was so awful, an after school special would be a welcome respite from whatever this was. The other actors are all unknowns - and...should probably remain that way, but they had awful material to work with. Still, none of the cast lifted this up from the dregs of middle school theatre productions, except possibly the high school senator's son. Save yourself and watch anything else.

When you watch a Netflix movie you expect a certain level of quality but not necessarily Universal; MGM or Disney. There are a broad range of movies on Netflix but this one is definitely better suited for Lifetime TV. I get what Alyssa Milano, the lead, is trying to do here, however, crime drama is probably not where she belongs. Her character is supposed to be smart but the reality is she comes across a angry, condensending and mean. She is after all investigating her sister's murder, however, you would want more cool and calm to demonstrate that she is in control. She never seems to be in control. The police department is inept in every aspect that at no time does it seem anyone is really in charge of closing the case. There is just a lot of running around asking questions but never any real analysis to consolidate the data for the viewer to draw their own conclusions. Hallmark Mysteries does a good job for the viewer by combining drama, romance, mystery and humor in one package. Brazen doesn't have humor, romance is clumsy, no drama or mystery. It is apparent early who is the murder. As a fan, I would like to give Alyssa a higher score, but that wouldn't be honest.
Allysa looks awful in this. Is she ok? Something seems off about her. The movie is pretty good though. I've definitely seen worse. I don't like spoilers so I won't include any here.
Just awful. So bad it's not funny. Sister of murdered dominatrix is allowed full access to work on the police case just cos she writes crime novels hahaha it's ridiculous.
She should stick to politics and spewing vitriol. As a witch, she had some good moments in that series. In Brazen, she simply added nothing. Stilted, odd, breathing issues?

reviews.review_title: That's a one and a half hour of my life, I'm never getting back :-/
reviews.content: Let's get the obvious out of the way. The 1 star is because IMDB does not have a way to give ZERO stars. So the actual rating is 0/10.Unnecessary woke-fest, bad writing, bad acting (*shudder*), bad script, weak plot (could see the killer from a mile away).Hopeless dialogues that would make cringe cringe.Whoever thinks this is a good movie, really needs some time alone to introspect life choices.I sincerely hope Netflix makes better decisions on what to host.P. S.: Don't believe any review that praises this atrocity on cinema. They're either well-paid or completely woke-washed.

reviews.review_title: Masterclass on how not to make a film
reviews.content: Usually I don't leave reviews but this time I will do it so that people who, like me, decided to see this movie because it appeared in trends will never do it again, it is a waste of time, its script is absurd and sometimes One as a spectator can even feel offended. Do those who produced this film really think that we are so stupid?

I wanted to watch, because Netflix showed this as one of their top movies.This is literally the worst movie I've seen! There cannot be any other reason for Netflix to promote this other than it being a USA show and this is racism.

At first going into the movie I didn't know this was a made for tv Netflix brought film. It discouraged me abit because usually they are all the same. I was pleasantly surprised by this one because though it could be predictable I still thought the killers reveal was good. I thought the pacing of the plot happened a little fast though as Grace moves back to her sister. Yada yada happens to her sister she meets the cop next door yada yada then she helps them solve the murder I think if the film was maybe longer it would have been better. Cast were ok aswell.

Netflix has put out some great movies. This is not one of them. Boring plot and dialogue. At times, the characters act like they are intentionally trying to make a lame murder mystery TV movie. I would rather they save their money and efforts for better movies than waste it on making bad movies just for the sake of more content.
Wasted 20 minutes of my night with a boring movie where actors could only play at a primary school level. Slow and unconvincing. Should come with a warning, beware, bad movie!

I loved this! I'm a big Nora Roberts fan. The story is typical of her thrillers. I read this book years ago. No heavy swearing or graphic sex. I can watch it with my older children without being embarrassed. I like Alyssa Milano. I havent seen her lately. It's just a nice cozy mystery. It's not everyone's style but I enjoyed it!

I don't like to leave comments, especially negative one because I know time and effort are put into this movies.... But this is a really terrible movie, whoever wrote the movie should be suspended or something, for wasting everybody's time. It's really awful. It's not worth the time.

I really wanted to love a film that has a woman over 30 years old as the protagonist. And nothing at all against the actors in this movie. But the story is just so improbable and this terrible murder is sort of treated like a way for the main couple to get together, which makes it seem so trivial. I'm not familiar with this author - maybe the book has more substance. If you like this genre, this is a perfectly acceptable addition to it, but it's not my cup of tea.

The reviewers who referred to this film as a Hallmark apparently doesn't know the Hallmark formula. I love Alyssa Milano. Her cleavage wouldn't be allowed uncovered on Hallmark. Really like Sam Page. I've seen this little movie at least thirty times over the years. It is the actors, what they bring to the screen that boosts the film's ratings. Us single gals enjoy a little romance courtesy of Netflix.

reviews.review_title: There's literally nothing interesting about this film
reviews.content: It feels like a first time script written by someone who aspired to write for Lifetime. Standard paint by number characters, dialogue and situations. Two hours of your life you'll never get back.

To be honest, I would not have bothered if I'd realized the movie had Alyssa Milano as the star. I saw Sam Page and Emilie Ullerup listed, both of whom I really like. I gave the movie a 3 because the actual story was pretty good, but otherwise it was horrible. Most of the actors did a decent job, but Alyssa Milano was terrible, worse than anything else I've seen her in and totally ruined the movie. Her character is condescending, boring and distracting. Additionally, she doesn't have the body to dress up as a dominatrix. I would have I totally wasted my time, but I watched it while using the treadmill.
Very bad story (got the killer at first sight), bad acting but proberbky most of all bad direction. Completely waste of time. Not even bad in the fun way :-(

Just had a read of some of the reviews and a few were really harsh and some even having a go at a 'aging actress' that's just so harsh and I feel sorry for people with that type of attitude truly. (Also we all age) and if the person who wrote that looks half as good as her at her age well, I'm sure they will not.I actually enjoyed it, it wasn't a ten star film but I was entertained enough at least, just a crime movie. It wasn't the best film I've ever seen but it wasn't boring either.

reviews.review_title: Zero needs to be an option
reviews.content: Unfortunately I had to give if one as zero was not an option. Don't know where to start, the horrendous script, silly plot, dispicable characters, awful acting. Nothing entertaining of interesting to see here folks take my advice and just move along!
Alyssa is a really bad actor. Starting from that position we have a ridiculously presented whodunnit thing not worthy of Channel 5's afternoon slot. Give it 10 minutes and then agree.

Well it passed the time and I was wanting to watch something uncomplicated. OMG - like watching a substandard daytime made for TV movie. Bad story and script, bad wooden acting, bad sets, laughable action scenes and excruciating romantic scenes. The student villain was unintentionally funny and punched a much bigger student to the floor, the Dominatrix videos playing on the walls of the CEO's office were ridiculous, the brief Dominatrix scenes were funny not sexy, the police men stupid and useless, their female boss a stereotyped kickass and the female crime writer an Uber clever, brilliant detective - I as a female am all for women representation but this was 'in yer face' feminist nonsense and does our sex no favours!. Script and storyline was formulaic and like watching a parody of a 70's/80's crime movie. Just BAD! Other than that I enjoyed it!

Me thinks that this was a bit too racy for The Hallmark Channel, which is really where it belongs, and that's how it ended up on Netflix. But I watched it anyway cause Ive always had a girl crush on Alyssa Milano and now I'm just jealous of her boobs.I feel like everyone involved in this film was just casually in town at the same time and they sorta decided they'd make a movie in a few minutes.I got the sense they all know how to act but they had to dumb down their efforts to fit the budget and the audience. That's usually the case with all Hallmark films and the reason I know this is because my mother in law has it on 24/7. This is great to have on in the background if you are trying to take a nap.

It felt very "made for tv" movie, rather than Netflix thriller... typically I love Netflix originals. This movie isn't horrible, it's just predictable as hell. It's good for putting on in the background when you do other things.
Wow!! This movie was absolutely terrible on every level. If there is funding available for this kind of drivel, we should all write a script. Surely they couldn't be worse.
Frankly this is not a Netflix type of a movie ..it is more like small budget TV level type predictable movie ....full of holes & weak script ....Again a failed feminisme typeo ...Avoid it.

I can't remember how long it's been since I've watched a movie that I've fallen asleep watching!! I didn't bother reading the reviews before I did, but that won't happen again. I only watched it because it's on Netflix! What were Netflix thinking!!

reviews.review_title: Nothing Spectacular but a Fun Watch
reviews.content: I've been a fan of Nora Roberts and her novels for years, but I don't remember reading the book this was based off of, so I can't compare. However, I gave the movie a shot and it was okay. I figured out the killer as soon as they were introduced, so there really was no guesswork involved. It was a pleasant, brainless watch for a Sunday afternoon, but I won't watch it again. There seemed to be some uneven dialog in areas, where I thought maybe it was just bad editing or bad writing, but otherwise the plot sort of flowed well. The red herrings were obvious though.If you're looking for a brainless, not-too-serious murder mystery different from the Hallmark movies you're used to, it's a decent one, but I think the book would be better, as seems to be the case with most Robert's adaptations.

We (Hubby and I) wasted 1 hour and 36 mins of our life. We want a refund, lol. Most of the acting was okay, but the overall movie (plot, story line, etc.) Very predictable and drraawwwnnn out for absolutely no reason 🙄 lol.
I would rather poke myself I the eye with a sharp stick them watch Alissa Milano act... she is a poor excuse of a person and not worth the time and day to watch act....

Classic Lifetime-TV-soap-opera-women-crime-trash movie.Production is High-end TV quality (slightly below average for a non-TV movie)Acting is alright and story is basic but could work if the movie wasn't mind-numbingly stupid.Main character is a super human fiction crime author who knows better than anyone, even the police ("You are one of our most astute profilers" -says the Police Chief Captain to our goddess)She gets the hot, friendly detective who is much younger than her (all while quickly taking over his job and solving the case for him).She has in-human super psychic powers, so she knows everyone secrets and when they are lying. She also lures in the bad guy by taking over her dead sisters secret life as a dominatrix and mind-playing him (or something).The movies technical aspects are okay but direction and visuals are obviously stale.Story is for sure someone's fantasy (likely the author's and maybe the director's as well) but bottom line is that this is writing of the lowest tier.It is, what it is3.5/10.

reviews.review_title: The film can be watched if you feel that you have Leisure time
reviews.content: An ordinary story for a movie.. The killer can be expected at an early moment in the movie.. The main actress is very provocative and annoying.. They assign an important role to her in the investigations, and actually she did nothing in the investigation.. And whoever came up with the result was a routine police search.. The lady, the police captain, is naive to allow the main actress to participate with her in the investigation.. The film can be watched if you feel that you have Leisure time.

reviews.review_title: Must have been written by a student
reviews.content: Quite surprised to see Milano in such a low budget, non-interesting movie. The plot is extremely linear and totally surprise-free. From the start of the movie, the killer is blatantly obvious and personally, I was expecting some kind of plot twist but alas, there was none. The casting is straight out of a Hallmark movie, they are of community theater quality. Even Milano is giving the least amount of effort. Her physical appearance is straight of soccer-mom, I don't think she even tried to lose some weight and get in shape. I guess the producers couldn't find any one famous enough to star in this piece. Summary: Don't waste your time, swipe left!

This movie was so predictable... It was like something off the lifetime movie channel. When they showed the senator at the funeral and nowhere else in the movie and no reason for her to be at the funeral, it was so obvious that her son was the one who did it. I've never been a big Alyssa Milano fan anyway.
Horrible acting. Horrible scenario. Horrible directing. I've just decided to make a movie to pass it to Netflix. I guess they are OK with anything visual.

reviews.review_title: Nora Roberts is not to blame...
reviews.content: Nora Roberts is a talented author. It's the acting that wasn't quite right here. Actually, the teenagers were the best actors and the character of Kathleen was good too. I did finish the movie.
A Great mystery movie thats bot worse than others. The story, caracters and ending are just fine. The movie is wel build as the story also is.Most review here aren't objective!

The story, the script, the characters, my GOD it's all horrifying. Alyssa's character is... well let's just say she walks into the police station and says "I should help because I am an AWARD WINNING author and I can *get into the minds of murderers*. No one knows motive better than me." and then they LET HER HELP. Like full on include her in the police investigation. As if.

reviews.review_title: I created an entire IMDB account to warn you all
reviews.content: I didn't expect this movie to be stellar or anything, but now that it's done, I absolutely can not believe I sat through the entirety of that movie. It was so bad. The killer was ridiculously predictable and the acting and script was laughable...but not in one of those so bad you kind of enjoy it sort of ways...more in a "wow, did they really go with that line twice?" kind of way. Run for the hills. Don't trust Netflix top categories. Just run.

When Hallmark goes to Netflix... and the "Murder she wrote" meets the worst Agatha Christie. Now Hercule Poirot is a superhero in my eyes.My worst concern is: someone financed this so called crime story and that person capable of anything. Be warned.

reviews.review_title: Light and easy mystery for sunday afternoon...
reviews.content: Monika Mitchell delivers an easy-going "friendly" mystery. The plot is simple and straight forward.Ms. Milano delivers the best performance of the cast but the others involved are ok.The music and the score are non memorable.The dp made a good job, pretty decent.Good movie, enjoyable. Not an oscar winner nor a mystery Agatha Christie might have written, but it´s still nice. Good movie for a sunday afternoon while it´s raining. Maybe even covered with a blanket.
Netflix has put out some apocalyptically bad stuff lately. If you're insanely bored go for it, but this was worse than I expected.Movies a gigantic joke.
This was a okay lifetime tv style movie. I was clueless in this whodunit until about 20 minutes left in the flick. The casting was good worth a watch. Alyssa Milano is still charmed.

reviews.review_title: I've seen worse films but really can't remember when
reviews.content: If cheese was a film, this would be it. They make the killer so obvious that you think it can't possibly be the killer but it actually is. It leaves you begging for at least one plot twist but there just isn't any. I've seen more convincing and entertaining primary school nativity plays than this film. 1 star is too generous.

They certainly were. To put such junk to film. The story line is poor. The acting is mediocre. The police chief is 2 years old. Another dude with some hair is around for no reason. A killer who normally sneaks on his victims now decides to carry on a meaningless drawn out conversation with another potential victim. The police set a trap and then the entire police rush off to kick a door to the basement at a senator's mansion and eventually one lone cop makes it back to save the day - I guess only because conveniently he lives next door. Worth a miss.This review really does not contain spoilers - the movie was spoilt before I got here.

What has happened to good cerebral story telling? 5 minutes in and the viewer gets bombarded by "wokism"splaining and bad.......bad acting and writing. Please Netflix, if you have the budget to pay these "actors" and "writers", spend it on solving world hunger rather, at least I can sleep well at night knowing my monthly subscription is contributing to a good cause.

PLEASE DON't WATCH ITDid the cast and director watch the movie?Bad acting, bad direction, bad editing.With this plot you can make such a nice movie with the twists and all. Please think before you make a movie.Producers if you have too much money please give us some but stop making such a waste of time.

Slow moving movie and numerous stereotypes. Story line very predictable. Boring and unimaginative. Milano is not the suspenseful type actress and the support cast is no names you expect to see from a Lifetime movie. Again what police force allows a family member to investigate a murder? That part is insulting to the viewer.

Hahahahahah
What a joke of a movie. Omg the acting, oh wow. Hahahaha ! Women are angels and in charge and white men bad apparently serial killers or cops killing other people!

Total waste of time.A writer gets approval to work with police "with access to all materials and information needed" because she has good instincts. WOW!.I cannot comprehend if this is rewarding or an insult to the police department shown in the movie. So predictable, boring dialogues, Unnecessary scenes. Illogical.I rated 4 out of 10 for the production team only.Not recommend movie at all.

reviews.review_title: So, so bad! I mean REALLY bad.
reviews.content: I used to be a huge Nora Robert's fan so I was excited to see this movie coming to Netflix. Man was I disappointed. Acting is lousy. The pace is lousy. Story is lousy. In all honesty I made it a full 40mins in before I simply had to turn it off. After movies like Bird Box and Old Guard, I've come to have high expectations from Netflix but this movie is a dud. Netflix, please do better.

I am! Therefore I shut this movie off 15 minutes in. Absolutely dreadful. How this was #2 on Netflix at one point is beyond me. The acting was awful, the writing was awful and it looks like it was filmed with a 5K budget. Go watch paint dry.

reviews.review_title: I was playing on my phone
reviews.content: As there was nothing to miss at all. I watched to see if Milano has it. I guess that is why it is in the top 10 of Netflix. In this film she doesn't have it.The story is so lame, the acting too.And wtf? She is the bait and no officer stays with her to protect her in case the murderer shows up?!There are actual profilers out there working with the police anyways but no they just waited for Grace to say that she is an author who writes about murders. That makes her profiler, you know.

Its hard to believe that someone actually got paid to write the script for this pathetic and mind-bendingly idiotic rip-off of the Castle TV series. And it doesn't end there. The acting performances are all excruciatingly bad. They may find the killer but nobody involved in making this movie survives. So astonishingly bad I watched it all.

Being Friday evening and seeing that this movie was pretty hyped up I decided to give it a try .... bad idea. This movie was beyond bad .... the plot was weak and the plot twist was non-existent. I figured it out the who did it within the 10 minutes of the movie.The acting was equally bad .... throughout the entire movie I had the feeling that it's a cheap cheap movie (not that it wasn't but at least with other movies they at least try to mask it).I think I managed to watch like 30 minutes of it and the rest was skip-skip-skip since I don't like leaving movies and shows alike unfinished ... but yeah,overall it was a bad experience and I regret wasting my time on it.

The story is so poorly done that you find yourself yawning. The acting is very questionable by Milano. You find yourself waiting for her to be the character but it really never happens. She at times stares off or is slow with her lines and it makes the film boring. The lead male just seemed like he just stands there as the camera zooms in on smiles on often, but nothing exciting happens. The killer is the only one that wasn't too bad.Lastly, the film was focused so much on Milano that the other characters hardly developed. It was a very, very boring film.

3 stars , only because I love Nora Roberts and I'm hoping another movie will be done. But Lord , the acting and directing was awful. Alyssa Milano , was disappointing, but her assets were the main attraction.

reviews.review_title: This watches like a cheesy Lifetime movie.
reviews.content: Totally predictable movie. Ok acting but dumb plot. Expected so much more since it was ranked in the top 10 for Netflix this week. Guess everyone was giving this movie a chance.

"Brazen" is based off a book by Nora Roberts titled "Brazen Virtue". I always recommend to people if they're going to watch a film based off a book to read the book first. So, if you haven't yet read "Brazen Virtue" I highly suggest you do so. Like any movie based off a book there was a few changes to fit a movie time frame. There were moments when I felt the film was being rushed, like they left out a few key points. However, that didn't effect the film at all. The acting by Alyssa Milano (Grace) and Samuel Page (Ed) was really good. I thought they portrayed their characters really well. I also thought Malachi Weir (Ben) did a fabulous job. The only part I thought was cringe worthy was Grace's outfit in the end. To me, it looked super tight and uncomfortable, like Grace (Alyssa) could barely move in it. I thought the movie was enjoyable and entertaining. The book is definitely better, but the movie wasn't bad.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've ever seen but close
reviews.content: Ugh really bad acting, bad story just all around BAD save yourself an hour and 36 minutes. Why this is trending on Netflix I will never know. Watch pretty much anything else instead.

This movie is poor from beginning to end. The plot as well as acting and script left allot to be desired. In fact, the entire thing was soo ludicrously unrealistic that I could not take it seriously, even for a moment. Consider this scenario.. A grieving sister is given permission to assist with the investigation of her sisters death, citing her credentials as a murder mystery writer, the lead detective of course can not refuse this offer of assistance as a fresh new (no conflict of interest*) perspective is always appreciated. And to top it off she must conveniently dress provocatively as a dominatrix to lure the sadistic teenager. Its almost like the director is admitting that the movie is soo poor that the only way he can keep viewers engaged is by dressing the lead actress in as close to nothing as possible.Consider This is a public service announcement and don't watch this. You would be better off doing absolutely anything else.

The characters are terrible, and act too. Everything in this kinda BBBB movie is surreal. From the main character, Alyssa Milano (the sister) till the embarrassing story. The police seems from "Police Academy", "Spy like Us" or "Dumb and Dumber" but the problem is that those was very funny comedies and Brazen pretend to be a thriller (...).
