The end it's something weird or funny, now don't wanna spoiler (...) but has no sense at all. Stay far from this movie don't waste around one and half of your time watching this thriller parody.

Showing my age but back in my day this'd be categorised "Straight to Video". If this was something found in a 3,000 word short story competition in a creative writers' magazine, it'd probably do well.Except, this is supposed to be a 96 minute film. In brief, a serial killer's on the loose, the victims are part-time online dominatrixes . Somehow, a crime writer whose sister was one of the victims finds herself appointed by a police chief she'd never met, and who looks like she's straight out of school as a "consultant". The local police, including some guy with a Don King haircut, seemingly are that incompetent. Eventually a lanky teenage screw-up with mommy issues is in the frame.Things to not like include, but aren't limited to, wooden acting, unbelievable characters, doubtless flawed representation of police procedures, and distinctly ropey and cliched storyline, such as it is.It can only be in the backdrop of the madness of 2022 that Netflix could have the cheek to increase irs charges whilst asking the subscriber to accept tripe like this.

reviews.review_title: I don't understand the low ratings
reviews.content: Book to movie. Definitely a made for TV 7/10.Really great to see Alyssa Milano back on the screen in a strong independent role.Easy to follow, easy to watch. Some little anomalies but easy to overlook.

Entertaining movie. I would watch more stuff like this if Netflix had it. I like to guess who done it. Alyssa Milano is always good. Give it a chance, if you can watch it you're already paying for Netflix so what's it going to hurt.

Not a bad movie, quite predictable enjoyable hokum and escapist fun. Congratulations on the good plastic surgery on the leading ladies. However, the question is, where has Kylie Minogue hidden her neck?
Perhaps the worst movie I've ever watched. Terrible acting, terrible dialogue. Simply terrible. Save your time and watch something better - maybe paint drying?

reviews.review_title: One extra star for the lead role
reviews.content: This is so bad. I would cry if I saw anyone in the police being like that trying to solve my case.Was the script done by AI software based off 90s drama movies?!
I think this movie was good. Love Alyssa Milano But I felt like we needed more. Give us a 2nd with the same characters . Romance ,action and mystery are my fave.
I should have read the reviews...this is similar to the boring eighties crime "drama" MURDER SHE WROTE. Poorly acted by the usually talented Milano who really should have passed on this film.

reviews.review_title: Sexy leads with great chemistry cannot carry this film.
reviews.content: "when you wade in, you go hip deep."-EdThis is the story of a crime writer named Grace (played by Alyssa Milano) who gets a call for support from her younger sister Kathleen (played by Emilie Ullerup). After a reading of her latest book, Grace drops everything and flies in to see her sister who is a divorcee who has cleaned up her life (she was addicted to pills) and is on the verge of suing her husband to get back custody of her son. Kathleen is working as a school teacher and living in their childhood home in Washington D. C. When Grace arrives, she meets the next door neighbor who is the decorated detective Ed played by the very handsome Sam Page. Ed who is fixing up the house next door hits it off with Grace and asks her out...which is what is happening when Grace's sister is murdered next door. Grace discovers the body and Kathleen's secret additional income source! Kathleen is an erotic webcam performer named Desiree. Grace talks the local police chief into letting her consult on the case as "fresh eyes", which puts Grace at risk to Ed's frustration.The mystery was ok, there are some hot moments between Grace and Ed, and I did like some of the supporting cast (like I love Emilie Ullurup and really enjoyed Malachi Weir). This was based on a Nora Roberts book and you can tell that the writer Grace was romanticized a bit. Not a recommendation from me...but I did enjoy the relationship between the two leads. They had great chemistry!

This monstrosity should be deleted. Dont watch it. The quality of the plot is so ridicolous that I almost cant believe how this got made. I would rather take an jackhammer up my ass than watch this again.

I can't believe this movie was made 2022. It was utter garbage.The plot didn't have any twist, and the scenes where just coming one after another without any attempt to create an atmosphere for what was going to happen. The acting was horrible, especially Alyssa Milano's acting who's character was so unlikable. Her character was always seeking the center of attention while they were investigating the murder of her sister! She had to be there in the center of the investigation because she knew the best after writing some books about murder. She also had to dress up as a domina to lure the killer in. Both of these were her character's own idea and the police agreed without hesitation. Of course. Why not. It was so stupid.Total waste of time.

It was nice to see Alyssa Milano again. She absolutely did her best with what was given! Was this novel written after the Shades of Grey stuff? I don't know where to start.. I would cut or rewrite the sidekick cop role? Yikes. I just wanted to veg and relax for 90 minutes which is why I put this on. I'm normally very fussy! So I was able veg and relax and then alas got judgey.. meaning it's really not good. Could have been much better I think? I'm blaming direction and at least one script/casting mistake. Still it was 'mindless entertainment' - sometimes we need that right?
Glossy production and pretty people but no suspense, no mystery and no surprises. Allyssa Millano' s breasts are the only highlights.These production line police dramas are a waste of time and money.
Was a very predictable film, knew who was the murderer very early on.Alyssa Miliano didn't seem to want to be in the film!Easy watch while I was ironing.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as some reviewers say, but ...
reviews.content: Okay. This movie is NOT as bad as some reviewers make it out to be. Nor is it up for a lot of awards. It's a good "nothing else is on, let's watch this" movie.It has a fun cast. I particularly enjoy Samuel Page - who is in a favorite ad about an electric car with a cute electric dog, but I digress. And who doesn't love Malachi Weir and his crazy head of hair (If you don't, it's cause you are jealous)?Okay, the bad part. Alyssa Milano dressed up as a dominatrix and strutting her stuff was SO bad, it was comical as hell. It just didn't work out the way it should have, did it?!! I had to fast forward through it, it was so bad and I knew it wasn't supposed to be funny. But it was so funny. She should have taken lessons from Rosie O'Donnell. (Google it!!) I try to be as nice as I can in my reviews, but this was bad. And it cost this movie a star. I'm sure they're going to lose sleep over it.It's okay. Just.
This is classic storyline of writer finding the killer as I have seen to many Murder She Wrote shows. The acting is alright and sets alright. Costumes so so! Ends up being a rom-com.

reviews.review_title: "Once is not going to be enough"
reviews.content: Is this the start to a new era of a Murder She Wrote esque franchise? Maybe it should have been envisioned as a show because this type of bad acting and script writing works for a show like "You" but doesn't work as good when it's a feature film, even if they are both on the same streaming platform. I'd still watch more instalments as it was fun 'bad movie' night with friends.

It's an entertaining movie. Great work. Is it winning any oscars - no, is it perfect for a quiet Thursday evening - sure! Should you be minding your own business when it comes to someone's individual political opinions which has nothing to do with Movies - YES.

reviews.review_title: Simple story, didn't worth the 1.5 hrs of our lives
reviews.content: Alyssa Milano is one of my favorite actress, and we all know the hardship she had to go through with the bad people, and also started the whole MeToo movement.But this movie, where she is actually a crusader for women rights, is a bad one. The story is bad, and so simple that didn't even bother to add some complexity. No complex twist, no complex emotion, simple rich teen gone wrong problem.Except the acting, the whole movie will leave u feeling nothing.

Not a great movie but I enjoy Sam Page in most anything. I love his new look with beard and longer hair. I know him from Hallmark movies and enjoyed seeing him in a movie where he could be a bit more romantic.

Nora Roberts' adaptation embraced crime drama concept too soberly but couldn't escape its campiness. There was no tension and outcome was quite predictable too. Milano & Page offered little chemistry to solve whodunit mystery with seemingly questionable efforts.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as I wished
reviews.content: One of the worst movies I've seen in a while. Very predictable. I love the people in the movie and was hoping for it to get better. It needed a whole lot more substance.

I fully agree with all the bad reviews. For me the plot went downhill when Alyssa having just had a brief conversation with a total stranger (even though he is a decorated detective) and does not waste time in going on a dinner date at the said detective's house. And they play tonsil hockey as he walks her out of the door. All this while her sister is lying dead in her house. And when she blames herself for not being with her sister, the stupid detective in an apparent attempt in consoling her says: you will see her again soon, but not yet." Someone please shoot me for watching this codswallop.

reviews.review_title: Was this made for Hallmark Channel?
reviews.content:
Very odd , super clean, Uber sterile, homicide movie that looks like an episodic Hallmark show. The reviews have to be 150 characters so I'll keep typing...
The hair on every character was too perfect like an 80s sitcom, the dialogue was very un natural, not the actors problems, clearly a writing and Directing issue. I'm sure the dialogue read well written on page but didn't translate well to spoken...no one talks like this. The overall look is good, again too good, like a tv show
Ok that's 150 characters. Review is already more than I wanted to spend on this movie.

reviews.review_title: Fakety fakey doo -- feels like a (extremely) bad soap opera
reviews.content: I was about to write this review and read through the featured review that IMDb highlighted. In that review, the reviewer mentions how they don't believe that they watched the full movie because it is so fake. I totally agree -- but I could only stand 20 minutes.Unbearable if you have some level of critical thinking. Brazen feels like a bad comedy TV show. It is so fake and staged that you can't ignore. There is bad acting, and then there is Brazen's acting, which looks so fake that it feels forced, like that is part of the script.The main plot might be creative, but the quality is so bad I didn't care. If you have the guts, maybe you can try to endure to see where the story goes.

This was a terrible, predictable movie. I figured out in the first 30 minutes who the murderer was, but yet it took Alyssa Milano's fictional murder writer "expert" way longer. Probably because she couldn't get out of her own way with all her unjustified bitterness and anger.Also, I'm from Missouri and none of us insist on calling it "the show-me state". Maybe the writer of the screenplay thought it would make the Claire-McCaskill-esque Senator appear more controlling but it was just dumb.

A ridiculous movie, and totally waste of time. B or C movie all the way through.Very amateurish actors and nothing surprising at all in the movie...................................................................................
Very bad performance from all actors, very weak plot, silly script, and showing Alissa's boobs added more damage than advantage. The whole movie felt more like watching a poor porno.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the reviews make it out to be.
reviews.content: It's by no means a blockbuster but it's a decent enough effort,think of it as though your watching a TV series and your be ok.actings good enough for what it is.
Just what the title says. I watched 30 minutes of this garbage and couldn't continue with it, bad dialogue, interesting premise weakly executed and bad acting, make yourself a favor and avoid it.

No words to describe this collosal failure of a movie.I can tell you one thing though: losing a sibling does not look like that.Alyssa Milano should have never have lend herself for this poor script.She used to be a good actress but I guess the Botox robbed her of that skill.It was like looking at an episode of the Bold an the Beautiful.
Worst movie I have seen in years...not worth the time at all. Terrible acting, plot and lame script. I just strongly recommend anyway planning to watch to refrain from doing so.
Really really stupid. I wouldn't wish my enemy to watch it.Alyssa really wanted attention and nothing in this movie makes sense, baaaaaaad story, stupid acting, and baaad all over.

The sister and cop (grey hair) not the two main hero's of this story are the ones who probably acted the best and there side characters! Its boring, not thrilling or enticing what so ever. Watch it if you REALLY have nothing better to watch but I am sure you do - I'd give it a 0 if I could.

reviews.review_title: Very Lifetime Movie of the week
reviews.content: If you didn't know you're on Netflix you'd swear you were watching Lifetime. Terrible acting, writing and beyond predictable. The villian is obvious from the first 20 minutes in the movie.
Poor acting all around. It reminds me of a Lifetime flop movie!What a letdown. I finished it because I already made it halfway through. I will never get my time back. Lol.

reviews.review_title: Hardly gains a "meh" despite Alyssa's efforts
reviews.content: There was something interesting going on for a third of the film, keeping hopes up that a really unusual and bold twist could come up.Or at worst, in could turn into some campy, fun piece.Alas, the only surprise was the complete lack of one, whereas the depiction of police work became not just unconvincing, but also improbably kitsch.Still, kudos to Alyssa Milano who kept it as together as she could, simply by sticking to a character that was just too real for this kind of overused, worthless and meaningless plot.The reason I'm giving this a 5 is because there were some interesting dynamics (like the cop being a neighbor, allowing us to skip more forced stuff) and a few fun details like the other cop having clown hair.Overall, it seems people involved with this had very different perceptions of what they were doing, which probably is the main issue the project resulted in such an undecided outcome.

reviews.review_title: what a bunch of shi te.
reviews.content:
Oh so bad.Plz return me these 35 minutes.Suffered af.Bleh bleh blehNever believed actors can get so fkn bad wow, plz delete this title..................oh so bad
might be ther worst.

Is it great? No. Good? Meh. It's fine. Alyssa Milano has some very poor parts of this. She is not good. I really like Sam Page and Emilie Ullerup. Not their strongest performances, but the script is pretty flimsy. Direction isn't great. It's a made for TV movie and it's fine for being just that.

It's a movie based on a Nora Roberts novel, so it leans heavily into the 'cozy' genre tropes. You should pretty much know what you're getting going into it. I'm mainly leaving this review to counteract the very obvious brigading by small-minded misogynists in the other reviews.

Short movie but still boring and feels lengthy. Not an inch of thriller. The police doing investigation was very dull. There is nothing new in this movie. There are lot of similar serial killer movie. The author does more investigation than police and police chief agrees whatever the author says.

reviews.review_title: everyone was way mean in the reviews
reviews.content: Look it kinda sucked, don't get me wrong. It was relatively predictable but I've 10000% seen way worse. It's definitely not unwatchable, maybe because I'm isolating and can't find anything better I just think it wasn't that bad.

This is barely watchable, and I say barely because it's not downright terrible but it's also not going to win any awards.The characters are all basic. You've seen variations of them in basically every serial killer thriller every made.The acting is barely passable. Alyssa Milano is good enough to hold the audience's attention but only because she's good looking.Everything is easily digestible. It's made for a mass audience of suburbanites who want something quick, stupid and easy to understand.The story isn't great. It has the advantage of being relatable and current but it plays out so predictably that you can literally call out what happens next as you watch.This is mediocre in every regard and it pushes no boundaries and presents almost nothing new to the genre to make it original, perhaps except that it features camgirl dominatrixes which will appeal to the audience of horny teen boys who watch this.

I love me some cheesy Lifetime, because... it's Lifetime. But that's NOT what I want from Netflix. But I'll give this 4 stars for being unintentionally hilarious. What made this a comedy, rather than a gripping murder mystery, you ask? Literally everything- from the ridiculous "sexy" dominatrix scenes ("I can't hear you!"... err, hear what?!), the forced romance between "grieving" sister (she sure doesn't grieve long) and the conveniently located "hot detective" next door, the dopey police chief not only assigning said grieving sister to "join the force" and help investigate, but basically thanking her for solving the case singlehandedly because the bumbling professionals were no match for her feminine wiles and "twisty mind." And the ending was godawful to a degree even Lifetime wouldn't stoop to- the skinny weird kid landed the beefy tall guy in the ER without nary a scratch or blow in return, then proceeds to act (that's not quite the right word) as a tortured psycho in Milanos porn den, causing an overstuffed Alyssa (those poor, suffocating breasts) to spew her final genius analysis of the bad guy and roll around helplessly in uber tight leather. Aside from the semi refined production value, the writing and acting were first rate B movie material. I'm kind of sad I didn't watch it with a bottle of wine to really amp up the camp, because one viewing (sort of... I was writing a work email thru most of it) is all this gets.
Horrible and predictable.I only kept on watching because I thought it might get better but I fast forward the last scenes cuz I couldn't take it any more.What a waste of my time man.

This feminine dominated "who done it" inspired by novelist Nora Roberts is a good time waster for murder mystery fans.Alyssa Milano puts in good work as the novelist/profiler helping the police solve the murder of her sister.Sam Page walks through his supporting role as the typical detective.Well done in scripting, editing and directing by Monika Mitchell, Edith Swensen and Donald Martin who all follow standard procedure.It is worth waiting for the ending.
Terrible script. Extremely unlikeable lead actress. Also very cringe time to time. Netflix has so many bad movies and this one is one of the best examples.
I'm still trying to figure out what Brazen is about, a romantic thriller that has neither one nor the other. Definitely avoid it at all costs, it's not worth it.

All of the dialogue is over or under delivered. It doesn't seem natural at all. The character interaction is firced and unbelievable. Reminds me of daytime soap operas in the 90s. No idea why this is on the top 10 on Netflix. It's quality is well below what Netflix usually puts out.

reviews.review_title: How did a Lifetime movie get on Netflix?
reviews.content: I mean... It's not terrible, but it's not at the quality you've come to expect from Netflix. Definitely a cable channel movie... Lifetime, Hallmark, etc.

reviews.review_title: Had potential if not so predictable.
reviews.content: I totally understand that not all movies can be completely realistic, but the idea that two detectives would allow a random author to push their way into help resolve an important case, and push her way into questioning victims and suspects, super strange and silly. No one even suggests that she could be swaying the case with her biased involvement, and what kind of psychological qualifications do authors have? Weird and didn't even end interestingly unfortunately.

reviews.review_title: One of those "so bad it's good" Netflix movies
reviews.content: It's really bad. Everything about it is bad, from the plot to the horrifying acting to the nonexistent twist and the unlikelihood of so many things that happened in the movie to ever happen in reality. Alyssa Milano, bless her heart, should not be acting.The dramatic scenes were laughable. The tense/"scary" scenes were laughable. The emotional/sensual scenes, you guessed it, laughable. So if a movie makes me laugh so often with disbelief, even if unintentionally, I still think it's entertaining. 2 stars for this fact and for Sam Page who is extremely hot imo.
Even as made for TV movies go, this is terrible. Character development is almost nonexistent. The the plot is cinematic Swiss cheese. All around disappointment.

The whole film was absolutely ridiculous, the acting, the dialogue and the plot was horrendous. The sister gets murdered but we don't care because there is no prior character development. Her woman who's sister it is writes crime novels so of course she knows better than a detective.It was pretty convenient she happened to live next door to the detective that would take on the case...they literally move in together after meeting each other for the first time 5 hours earlier!When she found her dead sister the over acting was incredible and the detective just happened to be changing a light bulb outside so they could heighten the drama by showing said light bulb smash against the floor.The captain saw potential in the writer so made her an honorary detective (as you do!) The killer had size 11 feet so everytime they spoke to a suspect, they happened to have size 11 feet and they were arrested everytime.She somehow just randomly knew who the killer.Unintentional comedy 10/10
Crime thriller 1/10.
I cannot believe how ridiculous this movie is. Alyssa Milano is botched. Her acting was actually the worst out of everyone in this movie. I was cringing through every minute.

Seriously, who is the boss who greenlighted this trash?This movie is comically bad! Do yourself a favor and skip to the last 10 minutes and you will not have missed anything. The plot is so full of holes and dead giveaways that the "mystery" was solved five minutes after the murder of the sister. The only real mystery in this movie was if one or both of Alyssa's assets was going to fall out of her dominatrix getup.Alyssa Milano is in Razzy territory here, and in my opinion she is a sure fire favorite for worst actress. Everything about her part in this movie was hysterical- she was not believable as an author, then the Captain decides to anoint her a "consultant" on the case (no conflict of interest here, folks) and she takes over questioning suspects! Hahaha! For an even better laugh, watch the way Alyssa walks in this movie- too darn funny!All the women in this movie actually look like they were pulled from coffins, slathered with makeup and giving half an acting lesson. Just terrible acting all the way around.Save yourself some time and go watch something else. This movie is Terrible (with a capital T).

reviews.review_title: This movie is a lost cause.
reviews.content:
Sam Page is a good, good actor, but he no doubt, found this film was a hot mess.First, the poor script for the film version was never good. Plot lines wandered all over the place
Second, the poor ( just bad acting by Alyssa Milano, especially as the lead), was hard to watch. Terrible.Third, the director's job is to make all the parts of any story, wrk- and work well: the story, the actors, the cinematography, etc., etc. Never worked.:This director did not do their job.So, nothing good to say about this movie. Sorry, do not expect better. If you like trains, stay away. This is a total "train wreck".

First let me say that the drama exceeded traditional Hallmark movies. The lead actor is a popular Hallmark actor, but this movie did allow his talent to glow...a little. I think I wanted to be really surprised by the ending. It just seemed to come down to bad writing/screenplay. I love Alyssa! It was nice seeing her after "Insatiable." Basically two hours wasted.

reviews.review_title: Tried really hard to watch it
reviews.content: I just wanted to watch an easy movie with a plot. This had no plot. I tried so hard but I could only watch for 20 minutes. Had to change movies. The acting is horrendous. The plot is whack. It's so strange because the book is fine. Really.
Very bad acting... predictable plot... don't spend 90 minutes of your life to this movie! The worst scene is when she is holding umbrella with a sound of rain but there is no rain actually...

I should've stopped watching 15 minutes in. Kept hoping it would be better, but it just kept getting worse. From the time Alyssa's and Sam's character went on a date it became SO predictable. Don't waste your time unless you're into really bad acting. And who the....allows a police Chief to authorize a famous book author to advance to a Detective just cuz she'd written a book? Yes, I know it's a movie, but make it somewhat believable. And then they have them sleeping together (naked) on a leather couch? Ewww. Nothing like sticking to a couch! Reminds of late night movies of the 70's. Don't bother!

This movie was an all time low for me on Netflix. So horrible. Cops make a surprise visit to one of the students houses- rich dad gets in their grill, kid says- home all day, maid can confirm, dad pulls maid's phone number (business card?) from his pocket. Wow that's convenient. So horrible, I couldn't stop watching and assuming it was going to get better.
Movie is way too predictable and gives off way too many Hallmark movie vibes from the 80s or 90s. You know exactly who the killer is 15 mins in. It's too obvious.

Awful. The acting is so bad. Didn't even want to finish watching it. Waste of time. No nudity but definitely has some scandalous shots playing in the background multiple times as well as scenes. Entire movie is made around a dominatrix.

I chose to watch this movie looking for a cliche, but it was below even my low expectation.At about 1/3, I had reached the point in which I had already wasted too much time and thus "had to" keep on watching to see if it was as lame as it looked like, and it was worse.The actings, the dialogues, the characters.. I felt like I was watching one of those teen movies adapted to "adult" public.Do yourself a favor and use 1,5 hour to do something better.

reviews.review_title: Not Great but Not Terrible, Either
reviews.content: I love murder mysteries. This one wasn't really mysterious; I knew who the killer was almost immediately but it didn't make me want to quit watching the movie. The movie does look a little low budget but not terribly so. I recognized most of the actors. I felt like they did a well enough job with the apparently poor direction they received. The movie was very clean, even with the subject matter in it. I don't recall any profanity; there was no nudity. It's nice to see that Netflix is capable of making a movie geared at adults that is not rated TV-MA. Clean movies aren't just for children. There are a lot of us adults who prefer them without "adult" content as well. Sam Page and Alyssa Milano as well as Emilie Ullerup were all very pretty to look at it, except Milano in the dominatrix getup. That just ew, gross. I wasn't bored or I wouldn't have watched it all the way to the end. Ok movie.

Should be rated PG 5. Pretty poorly written and acted. Very predictable. A waste of time you can't get back. Alyssa Milano must need work. She's done much better. Did I mention it was lame? I guess it was bad movie Saturday at my house.

It's a snow day here, so we've been spending the day watching movies. This movie was trending on Netflix so we gave it a go. Just horrible. Should've been on lifetime, not Netflix. Extremely predictable, and the boobs were over the top (literally and figuratively). We do not recommend Brazen.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone is saying
reviews.content: The acting isn't terrible and the story line is decent and executed well. It's not a ground breaking/revolutionary movie, but it was definitely a fun watch. And it definitely isn't as cheesy as it could've been... I just don't think it deserves the 3.8 that it currently has.

reviews.review_title: It's true! Netflix will throw money at anythjng
reviews.content: Absolutely anything. Seriously. They don't even bother reading a script - they just make anything now. Any old junk can get through - I should take up writing, I didn't have any skill - who cares right Netflix?

We thought we'd watch this together, but my partner kept falling asleep. The actor's performances would be so much better if they had something to work with. Nonsensical story, bad dialogue, blah blah. I'm embarrassed for the people who made this.
A romantic, mystery and murder movie on Netflix. I Love the chemistry between Grace and the detective. Another 50 shades of Gray. It felt a little bit rushed but overall great movie.

I created an imdb account just so I could give this a 1 star!Alyssa Milano looks fantastic, but her acting is just awful. This whole film is very poorly cast and the execution of it just horrendous! You figure out the killers identitey within the first half hour! Can't actually believe I watched the whole thing, I blame my fever and six days of isolation! Waste of time!
To compare this to a made-for-TV movie would be an insult to made-for-TV movies. It's in a category all by it's self. Alyssa Milano tried her best but there was no saving it. Grade F.

Book writer leaves a book signing after a urgent call from her sister . Jumps straight into a cab and says take me to the airport. I'm the next scence she arrives at her sisters with a suitcase in tow with her stuff to stay with . Magical baggage sets the tone for this poorly constructed film .

Of course you know who the killer is from the way the camera focuses on him! Of course it's obvious from the get go! But that's not why you're watching this film.Kind of like double fudge triple chocolate sundae. You watch it for pure enjoyment. Enjoy!
Yikes, supreme cringy acting, none existence storyline, and the whole awful thingy. Hope you didn't waste your time like me not reading the reviews first. Just another typical Netflix film.
Just horrible. The dialogue was laughably bad, the police captain made decisions that probably violated all kinds of protocols, etc, etc. Is this indicative of the quality of Nora Roberts' books?

I really wanted to like this because I love mysteries but wow was this a joke. Tom and Jerry are less predictable than this movie. Can you call this a movie? It was so clear who the killer was in the first scene after the murder.Halfway through I asked my husband to look up who produced it and not surprising Alyssa Milano was the executive producer. It was obvious based on how she portrayed herself throughout the show. Completely self aggrandizing. Nauseatingly self aggrandizing. Self indulgent garbage. Is she going through a midlife crisis and needed an ego stroking? Not her finest hour.

When an inspirational high school teacher--who leads a double life as an adult performer for paying clients--meets an untimely end, her sister, a 'Murder, She Wrote' style/boss girl mystery writer, puts her own life at risk in an attempt to catch the killer. Meanwhile, said boss girl mystery writer falls for the hot-police-detective-next-door who ultimately gets assigned to the case. Cut-out characters and tired tropes (e.g. Down with the patriarchy) undermine the film, which, though watchable, is undistinguished both as a mystery and as a chick-flick/romance.

reviews.review_title: Not a first choice that's for sure
reviews.content: But despite that it's a fairly good to watch.Nothing too fancy and even a little bit forced (Grace falling in love at first sight with the detective/neighbour, etc), but entertaining to watch.I was expecting a little more though... the movie doesn't have any suspense at all...P. S. I almost didn't recognised Alyssa on the first scenes... I guess we all grow old and fat... 😂

reviews.review_title: Looked good but it was horrible.
reviews.content: Save yourself the time and skip this movie. The acting is horrific. There was absolutely no realism to the movie. It's truly embarrassing that Netflix placed its name on this movie.

reviews.review_title: Something that would never happen in real life
reviews.content: So in this movie you are able to spot plenty of stuff that would never happen in real life. It happens from the mere beginning. Some of the scenes are so ridiculous that they leave you laughing, because you are thinking could even something like this even happen. In other words, the story is badly written and I would not recommend you to watch this movie.

Just the worst not worth the time to watch it. You would get more out of watching hippos poop on YouTube. Speaking of hippos Alisa is looking chunky.makes me miss murder she wrote. After all the seasons of that show you still had to wait 49 min to figure out who it was 20 min in to this train wreck we knew who it was.

The story itself is good;
However the women empowerment useless shoving into the story destroyed the movie...
Don't get me wrong guys I am not sexist BUT come on, a police Captian that most probably got her job for the her cups' size and approved the help of the victim's sister and get credit on that from the sister was a real cheap cliche...
If the movie went smooth without these non sense it would have been a good one.But this is Netflix, double big mac extra females meals.

Netflix offered me this title so I told myself, that I will try something new out of my usual concept.... I played it while cooking, so I didn't pay much attention, most probably there was nothing what would really got my attention except Phoebe Halliwell, who still looks great. In about half of the movie I started to be concerned, about that there is lot of things happening in the first episode of the series....to my disappointment I realized, that it actually suppose to be the movie and nothing interesting or surprising really happened except Alyssa Milano showing her boobs....it was lame from the beginning till the end....

reviews.review_title: Forget the other reviews for the most part
reviews.content:
Was this movie predictable? YES
Was the plot a bit flat? YES
Was the acting award winning? NO......but, while sitting down with my wife just randomly putting something on Netflix, I don't regret it.There were parts of this movie I was invested in, which kept me moderately interested. That deserves an automatic 5/10. And I gave it the extra point for actually thinking about the movie after, what little things could have been changed to make it better.I'm not telling you to run and watch it, but if your significant other puts it on, you'll be ok!

Tough critics here, I found it entertaining enough. Decent plot, decent acting. Malachi and that hair is fun to watch. I think most of the bad reviews is because of Alyssa Milano's politics. Come on people, stop the hate. 3.8 rating is ridiculous. I think all of trumps children and grandchildren rates this move along with Fox News junkies.

It wasn't really 1star bad but then it was terrible. The acting was terrible. The plot was bad. What was the sister doing? Was the police a joke? Why were all relationships so shallow? The crying was fake, the laughter was fake, the love story wasn't there. So terrible it can make one laugh or roll the eyes. And yet I watched it and gave it 4 stars. Somewhere it would have might have been better.
Hey it is what is is a romantic mystery based on a book from 20 + years ago. It's better than many of the hallmark movies, but still isn't trying to be wuthering heights, its a bit of escapist fun.
This is a Lifetime Movie...enough said! The acting is actually worse than lifetime movie actors. I really like Alyssa Milano, which is why I gave this 2 stars.
Bets. Place your bets. 12 razzies is my guess. Could be more... I don't know all the categories.Actress and screen are a lock.Razzies. Razzies Razzies Razzies Razzies.

reviews.review_title: Good God, I didn't think acting could be this bad
reviews.content: Sam Page is the only reason this rating was carried to 1 star. Alissa Milano, just terrible. Terrible is being generous, her acting is flat out offensive. I really did my best to finish the movie, but it was just impossible. The acting was just too painful to watch. In short, this movie made "The Last Airbender" look like a award winning flick.

This is one of the few films I could not watch through, due to the poor acting performances of most characters. I gave up when the sisters Grace and Kathleen shared a bed, both actresses overtly being uncomfortable with the scene.Until that moment mrs. Milano not one single moment convinces me that she is a writer of crime novels, instead of Alyssa Milano playing a writer of crime novels.

Just bad bad bad bad bad everything is fake no emotions.I repeat again soooooo bad bad bad bad bad bad bad.Bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad bad.
Love Nora Robert's the movie did not disappoint. Not a Hollywood Blockbuster overproduced movie. Just a good mystery novel with a little romance. Milano does a great job playing her role!!!

reviews.review_title: I liked the cherry blossom trees
reviews.content: Honestly, I live and die for thriller and crime but this movie was frankly a flat fart. Alyssa Milanos acting was the only redeeming about this movie. I can enjoy stupid movies with plot holes and bad acting but this just felt like a lukewarm telenovela.Plot holes, bad acting, weak writing.1 star for Alyssa and 1 for the blooming cherry trees.

reviews.review_title: Predictable Lifetime TV movie with no chemistry
reviews.content: ***ATTN Ms Milano: You deserve so much better than this. You produced it. Please respect yourself enough to demand higher standards.***I think the script was written by AI. They must have cast Alyssa Milano's cousin as her love interest because he makes out with her reluctantly, like she's Harvey Weinstein's bellybutton instead of the beautiful goddess she is.2 stars instead of 1 because at least they weren't actively problematic and the specs (lighting, camera, costume, sets) were fine. There weren't boom mics noticeably falling into shots, audio was consistent, the characters looked appropriate in their scenes... they technically made a competent movie. It was just boring, predictable and awkward.

This is one of the most stupid films I've ever watched. There's no character development, the relationships are shallow and the actors give a mediocre performance. Disappointing.You can imagine that the book has way more depth and then the situations would make sense. But on camera, is just a bad film.
Weak, predictable writing on what amounts to a very low (or wasted) budget that is more akin to soap opera than full-length feature fare.Truly excruciating even for fan of the cast.

reviews.review_title: IF YOU APPRECIATE ART/CINEMA, WATCH TO WITNESS A DISASTER
reviews.content: I can now victoriously announce that I have already seen the worst movie of the year... Lets make that a decade.This the worst weekend movie one can invest in. But I urge you to see it, its just 90mins. So, please make sure to watch it. And, then comeback and read the reviews. There is no continuity in the acting, one moment they are fighting and the next they exchange gifts and kiss. And! Mind you all these while doing a murder investigation, the heroine/writer/detective 's sister.The murder investigation which was started with this dialog by the police chief- Lets get this party started. And... this police chief looks more like My friend's Hot Mom (18+).Somebody rightly said - Its a christmasy murder thriller! Please! Please! Please! If you are a true movie lover or appreciate art.... DONT MISS IT!

reviews.review_title: It's brazen to expect people to watch this
reviews.content: Save yourself and run away. Netflix should apologize to America for listing this as a top most-watched movie. At no point in this movie could I take it seriously. The only way we got through this movie was by creating a drinking game where you take a sip each time you notice horrible acting. Yes, we are drunk now.

I swear I feel like if I did some digging that some big wig tied to this Movie is related or married to Alyssa Milano. This is Netflix they know better they are not idiots. So listen do NOT waste the popcorn on this one , you will Never get that time back . If you want to see a great Movie on Netflix watch Don't Look Up. And don't believe some of the "reviews" in the Press that try and say it's about climate change. It's about a freaking Comet headed towards Earth and last I checked the Climate has nothing to do with Comets.

A fun romp! This is my favorite genre - movies that are chock-full of clichés and sanctimonious, unnuanced moralism. So moralistic is it, that in fact, it feels the need to justify itself preemptively by explicitly stating that Alyssa Milano's character's books are "important books about misogyny" and not profiting from it, and we can surmise from this that this movie is also equally important in "combatting patriarchy". The need to obsolve itself of any predicted feminist backlash, shows this movie's ass. Its attempt at moral purity rings futile, because it itself is unconfident in reconciling with its own sky-high moral code. Alyssa Milano of course cannot resist being "reluctantly" sexy - you know, for women everywhere! - in an arrogant display by both her and her character's supposed "selfless heroism". For this endeavor of being bait for the killer in the end (spoiler btw), the police chief compliments her for her "twisted mind". That line invoked to me that she is that kind of a scrappy girlboss, fluent in sarcasm who drinks right wing tears, from a mug that literally says that, which would not be heavy-handed in this movie. Her character also arrogantly purports that she as a crime novel-writer, is qualified to investigate a murder case. But I'm not complaining about any of this, I liked it, it's up my ally, a glass is dropped on the floor in slow-mo, which is always a good sign in my book. My only complaint is that the ending does not go off the rails enough, like The Boy Next Door starring Jennifer Lopez, but it's close.

reviews.review_title: I would have rather chased the cat (Skittles) around the house.
reviews.content: Where do I start and why bother? I would have rather chased Skittles our family cat around the house than watched this HOTT mess Brazen. So predictable and I wanted to like it but wow no wonder Netflix's subscriber growth is slowing. A mule in the cruel summer heat could have written a better script.Netflix do better or I am canceling dammit!

reviews.review_title: Can I get that Hour and Half back
reviews.content: Painfully hard to watch. Like others have said felt like a Bad Lifetime movie. Acting is horrendous in this movie by all. She is making out with the neighbor day after her sister murdered? Cmon Netflix refund my Hour and Half back.........

This film accomplishes the trifecta: terrible writing, terrible directing and terrible acting. There are no redeeming qualities here. There is no reason to care.It's like watching an extended episode of a very poor soap opera combined with a murder mystery.

reviews.review_title: The worst actors, Music, and story
reviews.content: Don't waste your time watching this movie. New actors and the story is stolen from other criminal stories. And the worst thing is the movie's music, sounds like a video game music.

Detectives reading thrillers and fawning over her books not exactly likely -- unless she'd been detective.The lines about "if anything happened to you, I'd lose my mind" and "Once isn't going to be enough." were super cheesy. Um, you've known her for like 3 days.Her as bait for her sister and the captain going along with the plan not believable or that boom she'd be convincing as a dominatrix night one. And serious case of too stupid to live with Grace luring him back and thinking saying "no one needs to die." will keep him from trying to kill her after he confessed.Yeah, it was obvious who the killer was IMMEDIATELY. Totally killed the suspense.Oh, my sister died, but lets sex it up with the hot detective next door.Wish I'd read the reviews first. I'm sure the book was better.

reviews.review_title: Rushed, cheesy but also entertaining enough
reviews.content: I don't get the hate or anger about this movie. Yes, production value is low, the film lacks exposition and some "conclusion" came too fast too early. But it was also funny, and Miss Milano looks awfully great in the S/M outfit at the end.Not a perfect (and too short) movie night but a fun one, easy to forget but without regret.

Like a grape that isn't good anymore. Acting, terrible. Story, boring. I commented to my wife that for movie based on her solving her sisters murder, it took much too long for her to actually get dead. I mean, the point is solving the mystery, right? I'm writing this review halfway through, because I'm confident this is not going to turn around.

Like a stereotypical Hallmark channel movie, missing only a Christmas scene. Acting was mediocre, at best. Alyssa Milano, a joke. Storyline was very surface, not much depth. Type of movie I'd watch only on a long flight and I'd already seen everything else.

reviews.review_title: Juicy concept marred by snoozy execution
reviews.content:
Some Friday night mindless trashy fun to take a break from that high-falutin 1001 movies list.But sadly not so fun...Alyssa Milano plays a mystery novelist whose sister, a teacher by day and secret cam girl Dominatrix by night, is murdered by an unknown assailant. Alyssa teams up with the hunky police detective next door to sift through the suspects including her sister's rich entitled ex-husband who is embroiled in a savage custody battle, sister's sullen air pod wearing student whose grades are slipping and the creepy school janitor that knows a little too much about sister's secret life.Sounds juicy right? I mean how do you get this wrong?Unfortunately it plods along at such a slow pace, that by the time we finally hit the reveal of the killer I had long since lost interest. The ultimate downfall is the lacklustre relationship between Alyssa and the cop-next-door. They do cutesy really well and then straight away get cranky at each other as the investigation intensifies. We never really get any love/hate sexual tension vibes and much as with the killers reveal, the will they/won't they dynamic is more like 'who cares?'The absolute highlight of the film is Malachai Weir (who you may recognise from Billions) as the laid back partner of the hunky cop next door. He is the perfect identification point for the audience as he honestly looks like he could give a stuff if the murders gets solved or not. Also keep your eyes peeled here for Alison Araya as Police Cheif who is absolutely hilarious in the new Peacekeeper series.Oh and it goes without saying - they missed a huge opportunity by dressing Alyssa Milano as a Dominatrix and NOT having her ask 'Who's
the Boss?'

reviews.review_title: Don't waste 1.5 hours of your life
reviews.content: I got through all of 19 minutes 39 seconds of this awful movie before I could take no more. I don't know which was worse the writing, the acting, or the oh so predictable plot. All in all it came off as a movie that was trying to take itself way too serious and was virtually unwatchable and cringe-worthy. My suggestion is that you skip it and find something at least mildly entertaining to watch instead.

There have been a couple films where I am genuinely pissed I wasted my time watching them. This is not one of those. That been said, as much as I like Alyssa Milano and Sam Page, they could have done better as far as picking a project goes. The story is not credible at all, what kind of police departament is going to allow the victim's sister to get so involved in the investigation? How come (understandably) Grace loses her mind upon finding her sister dead, but then spends the rest of the movie in the zone, completely in control? The motive for the killing was also very forced and the sex scene was pretty cringey. If you don't have anything better to watch then by all means give this a shot but if you have something better to do, don't waste your time.

It was entertaining enough to chuck on when I was home alone and bored, but not interesting enough to pause when I started online shopping on my phone.There was no real twist, the motive was pretty weak, "they're all Desiree!!" does not compute?? I didn't really get that as a confession/explanation - nor why someone would start confessing or admitting to things in a room he KNOWS has been used for filming and likely contains recording devices lolololThe writer (I've literally forgotten the main character's name) was very quick to take interest in the noisy neighbour, and very quick to get over her dead sister!

What a waste of my time that I will never get back watching this badly directed film. The dialogue is awful. It was like watching a real life Mills and Boon book. Honestly what possessed anyone to make this film? One thing I must hand to Alyssa, she has stuck to her M. O (acting awful films). She has definitely made her signature.

I've read the novel by Nora Roberts this film was based on, and loved it. This film, on the other hand, is not worth your time. Alyssa Milano does a decent job in her role, but the plot is too obvious and predictable to be rescued by a single actress. Read the book, skip this film.
It looks like a 90s movie, so stupid, characters are superficial, fights are comical everything looks soo cheap.I really cant understand what producer could think this movie was a good idea.

reviews.review_title: So obvious they could have said whodunnit in the title
reviews.content: I watched this because I love a mystery but the only mystery here is why Alyssa Milano agreed to be in this movie. I'm going to surmise that the person who talked her into it is better with words than whoever wrote this script.

reviews.review_title: Actors are fine, but the story is horrible
reviews.content: Usually I don't write reviews.... I mean honestly the actors are fine. The one that wrote this- damn, it's really bad in my opinion. The plot was no plot at al! It's cliche, predictable, and not researched. This is not how police work works.
Totally predictable! From the first 30 minutes I already knew who the killer was. Many scenes have no sense at all, poorly directed and ever worst edited. I gave a 2 just for Sam Page.

This was not just weak acting from the main characters (Alyssa Milano specifically) but incoherent. Grieving syster that is not so sad until required, guy with no connection or direction in the storyline. The story itself was pretty ok.You can watch while instagramming and you won't be missing much.

Seen this trending on Netflix and jumped onboard. The boat I was in almost flipped over numerous times but some how stayed afloat. I paused it 3 times to see how much time was left. Kept hoping for the show to kick into another gear. Once I hit the 75% watched point I was all in. I had to see it to the end to justify time I lost Sunday night. That makes no sense, just like this movie.

The film can't decide being a romance or a thriller. It doesn't matter, it's a big failure as both! The cast is awful, the screenwriting seems lazy, as well as the directing. Seriously, how Nora Roberts is a best-seller author? People actually pay for reading this kind of s***? Stay way!

reviews.review_title: A whodunnit if you don't feel like paying attention
reviews.content: Was not worth it despite starring Alyssa Milano. The script was meh, the acting was sub par, and the plot was see thru. Supposed to be a whodunnit but you have to be asleep not to figure it out from the beginning. The story had been written around cam girls and BDSM and they got niether concept even vaguely close to the mark. It's as if the author only ever heard of the concepts from a friend of a friend and tried to mash them into a murder mystery plot without bothering to do any research on the subject at all. Even with the movie containing scenes of BDSM, Cam girls, a torrid live affair it's done with zero eroticism. If anything, if you don't want your kids visiting cam girl sites then show them this movie. They will consider them too boring to visit.

Who actually looks at these projects and okays them? This person needs to lose their job because they really suck at it. This film is long, boring, and drawn out. It's basically a 10 minute story told over an hour and a half. And Alissa Milano... her best days were 35 year ago, and yet she has the audacity to call John Voight a B-lister, a has-been that never was, and a nobody. WHAT?! Lady, are you totally nuts?! This girl most definitely needs to take a long hard look in the mirror because I've seen better acting in my third-grader's Christmas play. (she was the second reindeer on the left). No wonder Netflix is losing big money with this kind of garbage.

I don't even know how I ended up watching this, but I'm sorry I did. I stuck it out to the end to see if I was right about the killer. I was.There are multiple issues which made it such a bad film. The acting was really wooden, the dialogue was cliched and unintentionally hilarious at times, the music was awful, the plot was dull and full of ridiculous things that just wouldn't ever happen, the characters were all two-dimensional and the whole thing lacked any sense of tension.Don't even watch this with low expectations, it's really far worse than I've made it sound.

Alyssa Milano is terrible. She over acts most of the time and is overbearing or irritating the rest of the time. Thinking she can just take her sister's place as a dominatrix is the ultimate in hubris! The teenagers do the best work in the movie. Even the music started to irritate, always just a bit too much. The ending was just too "perfectly timed". Sorry Netflix. This one just didn't do it!

reviews.review_title: You've got to be kidding me
reviews.content: Alyssa Milano has gone over the deep end. This appears to be a career ender. I'm not sure what they're trying to prove with this movie but it's a huge waist of time.

reviews.review_title: I would give it 0 if I could
reviews.content: Bad scripts, horrible acting, cheesy lines and awful casting.I seriously didn't expect this movie to be this bad and it just kept surprising me to remind me that it's bad.Arrrrrrr......horrible! Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie in the history of movies
reviews.content:
Sorry for the actors ( i like both Alyssa and Sam) but everything is bad, bad...really bad :(
The dialog, the plot, the ending... And the music had no connection with was happing on the screen.

reviews.review_title: It's Alyssa Milano so it's bad
reviews.content: What a loss of my precious time. Amateur movie, amateur actors, nothing original about the storyline. On top of it all we have the old fat cherry called Alyssa who makes everything even worse. So do yourself a favor and watch a real movie played by professional actors.
Amazing how Milano looks so good at 49... I focused mainly on that and not the acting or story. Sad her career never took off... she could still be a great action movie star. Let's keep hoping!!

This movie will keep your interest but it's a poor imitation of the great 'Murder She Wrote' series. It does have some 'red herrings' but not enough comedic dialogue or chemistry between actors to make it memorable.

That i even sat and watched till the end. So bad!Bad acting and bad ...everything!Sorry!!!!!Maybe the script was ok. But i hardly ever write a review ; all i felt was that i must be really getting corona tired to sit and still watch a movie this bad and actors that must be just as corona tired as in am, to work this way.

reviews.review_title: An enjoyable watch - ignore the low reviews
reviews.content: This was a fun watch and I definitely bought into the chemistry between the main characters. Nothing bad about it apart from some minor aspects being cheesing or unrealistic. Surprised about the low reviews: I'd give it an 8/10.

reviews.review_title: A perfect way to spend an evening
reviews.content: My wife and I rarely agree on what we want to watch, and then came "Brazen". While I don't read Nora Roberts books as a matter of habit, I will do so after this great adaptation.The movie piqued my interest from the opening scene. It's a film full of plot twists that keep you guessing. It definitely keeps the pulse rate up. Alyssa is paired with a great cast with whom she has great chemistry, in particular Sam Page and Malachi Weir. They play off each other very well. The plot offers too many chances for spoilers so I'll just say that it is suspenseful with just the right amount of emotional content in that it doesn't derail into a love story. It doesn't have the ending you'll suspect.It's enjoyable, engaging and entertaining. I plan on watching it again. And again. I liked it that much. I think you will too.

What an utterly horrid appearance and performance by Milano and amazing how Weir does not even seem to try to make something of the silly oneliners his character has been given. I wonder what is going on with the weird camera focussing too.

The first 15 minutes of the film was like an episode of Charmed. I kept expecting someone to turn into a werewolf. The remainder was a mix of a lifetime movie and one of those movies that used come on network channels around 8 o'clock in the 90's. I couldn't stop laughing.. everything was so wrong, so predictable.. I laughed so hard through the entire film.. so I gave it a four fir the laughs and nostalgia.

I actually died of boredom before that camgirl got killed. The broken lamp scene when the guy heard Grace screaming shows how moist the movie is. I feel sorry for myself for the time I wasted on this movie.

She's just as annoying on screen as off. Mundane slow and made for tv. This one is a hard pass. It's another movie where they try and dress up an aging actress in leather pants so dads will stay interested. As for now Alyssa remains just as irrelevant as the last 15 years or since Charmed..
This is an absolute garbage. I don't think I have seen anything this bad in ages. Can't believe how bad acting was as well. Just the whole thing is absolutely not worth your time.

I lost 1.36 hrs from my life watching this horrible movie.Do not loose your time, it deserve 0/10
The writer became the detective, oh my god, who got this fantastic idea?I watch a lot of bad film in my life but never one like this
The worst film ever.Can't say more.

Really bad movie, from script to acting. Wasted time watching this. The plot is too simple and there is no twist whatsoever. Thought the film could be okay by seeing it on Netflix Top Movies Right Now. Unfortunately didn't read any review first. Wasted time.

reviews.review_title: A 'who done it' wrapped up in a hallmark setting.
reviews.content: I have not read the book. But the initial concept does make promises - murder, an erotic atmosphere, a writer protagonist. One does not expect much but you do want a few tense moments, a twist no matter how small. Sadly nothing satisfies. I am putting aside the story and lack of tension, the writing is careless which causes the acting to be cringe worthy to watch. I felt like I was watching a regular 40 min episode of a light hearted drama series most of the time. There is no character build up, no relationship foundations set and zero attempts at allowing the audience to think for themselves and make predictions.Apart from that, the reality side of the matter makes it very hard to digest - the head of the police is just going to simply allow a writer to be a consultant after clearly stating that the lead investigator should ensure boundaries with the writer 5 mins earlier??? Then they allow this writer to use herself as bait to catch the serial killer after 15 secs of convincing??? Then this supposedly grieving sister is going to make the best of losing her beloved sister by moving into her deceased sister's home, get it on with the neighbour/lead investigator, live a happy life and completely ignore the fact that her nephew now is going to be raised by an arrogant pompous father???Sadly a complete waste of time and I feel sorry for anyone who invested in this project. Surely more worthy things could have been made.

reviews.review_title: When did Netflix start making lifetime movies
reviews.content: This seriously reminded me of one of the horrible and cheesy movies my mom used to watch on LMN. I'm definitely recommending this movie to her, for the rest of us that enjoys a good script and acting, just avoid it!
Minimal character development, a rushed semi-existent story-line, sub-par acting, a self-absorbed and unlikeable protagonist, and a boring story-line.

Its a long time ago i saw such a dull movie. With absolutely no tense?!! The acting is SOO bad!!! Alyssa Milano was over the top many years ago. And the chemestry between all the actors was unbelievable flat and poor. 1 star.every dat!!

I was suffering from a surgery where I had to extract my tonsils and fix up my deviated septum and to stop thinking about the pain that I was having I thought it would be a great idea to watch this movie, unfortunately this movie is awful and can be as bad as the pain that I'm suffering right now. I do not recommend this to my worst enemy.
Best movie ever! I'm not kidding. I know, that some might say, that it is bad, but right now i am watching it for the 4th time on 2-3 days. I love it! I can't even explain it!Recommendation!

I've read Nora Robert's, she's a great author, I did not read this book. Why do these shows always have women who have to help detectives who have previously solved cases just fine on their own? Also, I can't imagine a Nora book that has an angry woman screaming about misogyny and patriarchy. Then the next minute she's taking coffee to the neighbor guy. Whom she's kissing not much later. Alyssa is not a good actress, maybe she should focus more on that skill and less on Twitter.

What an awful experience.I would rather run a marathon on hot coal than watch this movie again. Also, the feminist perspective was pretty damn obvious. Who the hell would hire an author to do police work? I hope you do not watch this movie, it's a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: TV film like Lifetime meets Riverdale's NEON style with no Racial propaganda.
reviews.content:
I was looking forward to watch Alyssa Milano because she was my favorite TV actor from my teen. I could only watch half of the film because the rest has no motive to stay on.1.) Casting issue:
I don't quite get why the female captain chose Alyssa to be on the case. Female captain delivered the lines with robotic tone and poor body expression. Therefore, I was not sure how Alyssa's character got the job in this murder case since the family victim should not be an advisor. It makes no sense why this female boss allows her male detectives to go with Alyssa's random ideas (book fan or sexist?). This it the sample of bad casting and poor written of this film.2.) Poor Written:
The first half of this film. Alyssa tried to express her acting and dialog very well. Yet, the second half is the issue when the writers want to spell out or highlight the killer. It is too obvious that the male characters get strange lines to make Alyssa stop saying the long dialogs or sometimes they repeat each others. The poster tries to make this film as romantic thriller, but I don't get the romance in the film since the detective guy does not have a decent dialog or show the connection to the audience. He is more like a background character. Why borther made the poster like a romantic story? The film does not let other characters to breath, but forces them to dash and talk. The ending lasts only two minutes with zero chemistry of two characters.The only thing that I like about this film is NO Racial propaganda like those ABC or CW. The film does not push too many Asian, Black or Latino on the sceen because the only one spotlight in this film is Alyssa's chracter. The rest is not memorable due to the casting or written.

Sorry to say because i really do like Alyssa Milano, but the film is boriiiing, predictable, simplistic! Not sexy or hot! Not mysterious enough! The viewer knows straight ahead what will happen! Not to add that unrealistic stuff happens like the author helping out officially the police! Sorry but its for kindergarten!

reviews.review_title: Definitely Not NCIS or Law and Order quality!
reviews.content: This movie was just to difficult to watch! Resembled an older Lifetime movie, and mediocre acting. Predictable from one scene to the next, up till the ending. I have never been a fan of Nora Roberts books, and to believe the police would follow the advice of a murder mystery writer... No way!

If you have so much time to spend, this film might accompany you for that. The idea of the story is good actually, but it lacks flow and looks like the actors didn't really wanna do it too. I never read the novel so I didn't know how it should be, but I feel like this could be better.
Watching this actually increased my vision problems , the only worth thing in this movie was The Tea.... Awful! Looked so bad from beginning to end, Netflix Really??? Whyyy??

reviews.review_title: I think this movie is misunderstood
reviews.content: Give it a chance before reading the comments! Look, the "subpar" acting this movie is accused of is literally just realistic everyday behavior. They actors didn't go above and beyond because, having literally lived in DC, it's a wildly boring mundane local scene. People just behave this way. I liked the nitchy feel the behavior just seemed awkward and genuine just like real life. As for the movie, I found it to be a quirky "who done it" kinda film. It's not some box office film but its is a fun crime-tv kinda movie to watch.
It's so bad I want to give it a zero, but I can't, so I'll give it a one!! It was about as exciting as watching grass grow. And that's insulting the grass.
AWFUL. Alyssa Milano totally over acting, one dimensional and too much makeup to be believed. Choppy. Casting marginal. What a disappointment. Don't waste your time!

You know those Harlequin novel you find in airports, they are all bad. This is way beyond that. Everything about this flick is so cheap i almost cried. Can't believe those types of project pass the screening stages. Many, MANY! People had to be asleep at the wheel for that horrible thing to see light of day... and to those people i say, shame on you. Every project starts with writing and there's actually nothing in this garbage that can be remotely associated with writing. The « acting » is pathetic. The house where the « action » takes place is kind of nice, altough nobody will want to live there after that... come on people, stop feeding the masses this pablum! Please!

reviews.review_title: Decent idea but poorly written and poor direct
reviews.content: The idea behind the story is interesting. However not much depth given to characters at all. The whole movie feels rushed. So after one brief conversation Alyssa has now decided to be in a relationship? Why is her sister an adult movie star? Needs money? To express herself? Nothing is given. Also the police captain is just willing to allow a writer to take part in a police investigation and sit in on meetings like she is on the force? Again details and developing situations are rush The film should of focus on that instead of a play by play of Alyssa relationship with a cop who WOULD have gotten pulled off the if his supervisor sensed personal involvement and I believe he'd be reprimanded for.Like I said good idea but VERY poorly executed.

What an awful movie. The acting was okay-ish, but could've been better, more convincing. The screenplay was badly written, the whole storyline was way too simple, it really felt like a Hallmark thriller!With only a few twists and some more realistic decision making (by the chief of police for example, dear goodness), it would've been so much better.Also, the romance was unnecessary and over the top. It didn't add anything to the movie.

reviews.review_title: If I could do it all over...
reviews.content: ... I'd never watch this. Where do I begin? Perhaps stating something positive? That's a hard sell... A few of the haircuts were ok and the weather seemed to be nice. But one have to wonder; in a country (US) with lots of classy and literate people, why do you go for a scriptwriter that can't write and a bunch of actors that can't act? Surely, there must be more talent out there?

Exactly as bad as all the other poor reviews on here and the ending was abysmal. When Ed/Sam paige leaves Grace/alyssa in the care of two cops, he says to them "stay sharp", but there was no sign of them in the final assault scene. Absolute rubish storyline.

The acting was wooden, the plot predictable and the worst part was enduring 90 min of this trash.Save yourself the trouble and. Skip this one. This should be classified as torture not entertainmentCome on Netflix, this is not good enough...

I agree with Alyssa Milano's politics a 100%. I was really excited see Netflix's take on Romantic Suspense. I have always disliked the Lifetime/Hallmark take on the genre. I have read the book and enjoyed it at the time. But the movie is absurdly unbelievable and Milano was completely the wrong choice for the lead. The foreshadowing was so heavy handed it wasn't even trying to be a mystery. I read this book yeaaarrrrs ago. I had no memory going in who the killer was but I knew who the killer was in his first scene. I'm happier with the acting of Emilie Ullerup and Sam Page but Milano was not relatable at all. I'm sick of these movies treating their audience as though they are unsophisticated. I was hoping for a grittier, sexier take and Netflix did not deliver. Please going forward stop relying solely on the Name Recognition of your actors and sell the story. If anyone who has watched 20 minutes of true crime is going to call out your realism then make it believable. Stop overselling the plot. Please treat the material with a smidgen of respect and the audience like a woman's viewpoint matters. Netflix don't do a bad take of a lifetime movie. Take a sexy murder mystery and SELL it. This book was was good but it was published in 1988. It's actually book 2 in a series! The author has newer more timely material you could have brought to the screen like Come Sundown or Shelter in Place. Instead you pick a novel that is really old and only minimally bring it up to date. Do better Netflix. Treat the material with respect. Get direction that is less heavy handed and leads who can sell the story. I should have given this 2 stars but the rest of the cast don't deserve that.

reviews.review_title: I'd hibe -1 for the time I wasted
reviews.content: Honestly the movie is pad. The entire plot sounds clumsy right from the beginning. The actor who played the main character shall try better, it was a really bad acting.Looks like a very low budget movie, with the story written during breakfast..
Terrible movie. Don't even try to watch. Terrible acting, plot, characters, ending ... you name it, it was terrible. I wish I would not wasted my time.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyed it, give it a watch!
reviews.content: I honestly don't know why this movie has so many bad reviews on google ( haven't checked on here) I watched this with my mom and we enjoyed it so I say give it a go if you're looking for a decent crime solving movie 😊.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a crime scene
reviews.content: The producers should be arrested for crimes against humanity.bad acting, bad storytelling. Viewers should file a class action suit. If you watched this, you deserve compensation.
It was terrible. Just terrible, don't watch it, spare your time, and watch something else... Terrible acting, terrible writing... Bad characters, stupid dialogs.

SPOILERS(ish)Honestly the entire movie is so similar to the style of law and order which makes it pretty frustrating to watch.The ending is so predictable it's honestly embarrassing that I watched this.

reviews.review_title: 🤢🤢 so cheesy/should have been a porno
reviews.content: The acting is so cringe, the story soo cheesy, this really should have been made by lifetime, but - SURPRISE! IT'S NETFLIX! Guess they WILL make anything these days 🤷‍♀️ All of the characters are extremely one dimensional, the story felt so rushed and everything plays out exactly like you excepted it would. Honestly, this would have made a really good soft core p*rn with just a little more sex and nudity. We are also reminded of Jessica Alba's lack of acting abilities, depending on awful, fake mascara lines to help fake her hysterical crying, how can she over act but under act at the same time? The only thing I could think when the credits played was "BOOOOOOO" 👎

reviews.review_title: I liked the plot but it developed too fast
reviews.content: Not a bad plot and there were some interesting characters. Would have worked better as a limited series.The love interest develops way too quickly and so does the investigation.

You know a good crime movie when you get surprised in the end or have you change throughout the movie who the suspect is...well this isn't one of them. I honestly felt sad when finding the killer the second I laid eyes on him. And even before the death even happened. And when the writing tries so hard to misdirect you but you never once fell for it. I feel like it's mostly bad writing, but also nothing exciting from the actors that can save the movie. If you're the person who struggles to figure out who the killer is in crime movies...look no further! You will feel smart after this one...not rightfully so, but still. You got it...congrats!

reviews.review_title: It's not as bad as the 1 Star ratings, but still pretty bad.
reviews.content: You can often read that this film seems like a "Hallmark" channel one or "Lifetime" or something like that, and this rings true.It's exactly that badly written, corny run-of-the-mill film, these channels are known for.And there is also not really an actor in this one, which makes up for it in any way. Well, except for the love interest cop's partner.He plays the part with a lot of self-awareness for how his character is written and what kind of film he is in. It is a bit like he is sharing a wink with the audience, half the time.Now, you will read a lot about how horrible Milano is in this film and yes, she is not good, she is also not the worst actor in the film and at least with the 1-star reviews, you definitely can see that some people are rating this film due to her politics or her person and not really for what it is.Which kind of annoys me, because this is a bad film, and when people read this kind of review, they might think that it just got review-bombed due to Milano's politics.So, yes there are a few of those reviews, from what I can see about 10-12%, so, disregard the 1-star reviews, but probably also the 10-star ones, because some of these are probably that high to counter the others.I think this film is a solid 3, a 4 if you are feeling generous.Now, I did not feel generous and tbh, it is because the film is too focused on Milano's politics as well.The male cops are fools, men are creepy or evil or stupid, the female police captain is "sharp." Because of course it is very smart to let a crime novelist work on the case of her own killed sister, as if she is part of the police herself.Milano's character's books are about evil men, who hurt the weakest of society (probably women, I guess that's what she is saying? Maybe they didn't really think this through). It really is all so cringe.Look, the disinterest of cops to solve cases involving sex workers is a well established fact and definitely something that needs to be addressed and changed, in general how often women become victims of violence through men, also does not reflect well on our society.That much is true, but for me in any form of entertainment (film, book, game, TV show, comicbook whatever) the story and the characters have to come first, agenda, politics, topics, issues, representation etc. All of that should only come AFTER having a good story, a well written script.Here, probably due to Milano's involvement, it's just too in your face, too obvious.I don't dislike Milano, I loved her as a kid growing up with "Who's the Boss," liked her in Charmed, hell I even had lots of fun with her over the top persona in "Insatiable".just recently, but like with her former Charmed co-star Rose McGowan, it seems the more politically active they become, the worse their acting has become. Probably due to how much they focus on what is more important to them.I can understand that, but it's still a bad thing to happen with an actor, female or male.To sum it up, an unsurprising, badly written, weak-acted low-budget thriller, with a very unsympathetic protagonist and too overt involvement of agenda. And oh my god, was it obvious from the moment we get to know him who the killer is.Don't let yourself be fooled by the 1-star ratings either way, the film isn't a 1 out of 10, but it's also not only rated that bad because misogynists review-bombed it.

I like the author's books so much that I buy them without even knowing what they're about. Her name in the cover is enough. I like the actors too but the adaptation and the way it was all thrown together was sadly awful. It was obvious from go who the killer was, and who it wasn't. It was predictable and the dialogue trite and unnatural. It's a shame.

As a big fan of Nora Roberts' books, I was looking forward to this Netflix adaptation. Unfortunately, it was just so bad . . . And so boring . . . I couldn't sit through it. Zero chemistry between the leads, and the heroine came off as manipulative and annoying. Disappointing to see such a suspenseful book turned into a bland and tedious movie.

Alyssa Milano is as insufferable as always. Pure arrogance and zero charm. Terribly annoying. Other characters are not even worth mentioning. Plot is boring and predictable. You now who the killer is before murder even occurs. Wouldn't recommend.
This movie wasn't good at all, I laughed the whole movie bc it was so bad and it was so confusing.I would never ever tell anyone to see this movie haha.
