It passed the time on a Sunday evening but was incredibly underwhelming in its final act. Wouldn't recommend as it is predictable and lacks suspense throughout.

Movie was ok. What I'm most upset about is the American Flag being hung in the gym in the wrestling scene incorrectly.The blue field of stars should always be in the highest position of honor. When viewing the flag on a wall, the highest position of honor is the upper left when displayed horizontally, and at the top (upper left) when displayed vertically. When displayed on a "moving object" like a person or vehicle, the highest position of honor is the front, and not the rear; so the field of blue should be displayed to the front.

Honestly, this is one of the worst movies I've seen in a LONG time. As others have stated, this movie seems quite similar to a Lifetime movie. In my opinion, Lifetime movies are better than this one. In order for the plot of Brazen to actually work, the movie needs to be longer so that all the characters can be properly fleshed out as well as the plot. Brazen reminds me of a Cliff's Notes version of what this movie should have & could have been. Alyssa Milano is a terrible actress to begin with & she definitely highlights how poor her acting talent is here. This movie is so bad, I can't understand why it was produced in the first place.

Only One term we can think of to describe this movie: raw. Because of the object also this movie had to be the most pessimistic, it would also be possible to use numerous abilities with it, however, someone remembered these main thrillers that you present in Lifetime (or in the 5th channel in England). It would be possible to add a large number of turns. We look forward to the most with Netflix. There were not enough defendants in the mute, for this reason someone was absolutely predictable and somewhat apathetic. But we like Alyssa Milano, we think that the beloved is an excellent artist, also this movie was a useless waste of her talent. We imagine that the given existed is based in a book, which we did not recite in any way, for this reason we cannot compare in any way, however, the book must be more correct than the movie, right?

"Brazen" is not a passing, but frankly weak movie, if you look at this work of audiovisual content as a modern detective story. Flat characters; a plot that a first grader can predict; the killer, constantly flickering among the most obvious personalities - all this pretty quickly negates the little potential of the story. The charisma of Alyssa Milano in the title role adorns the movie in its own way, but does not add weight to this very depressing picture. Honestly, it's better to revisit the classic detective stories by Alfred Hitchcock ("Stage Fright") or Robert Altman ("The Long Goodbye") if you want vivid emotions and real intrigue that keeps you up to the finale.

reviews.review_title: Cross between a crappy romance and an episode of a police procedural
reviews.content: Reminded me of an episode of criminal minds, except they would have done it better. Very shallow character development, very elementary and pseudo-psychological motive created. Killer obvious before the first murder even occurred. Glad I didn't devote my full attention to it. I hate those soapy formulaic romance movies (Hallmark style) anyway, and the romance in this movie was less believable than those. I'd skip it except as background noise while you also do something else.

reviews.review_title: I'll never get that time back.
reviews.content: Terrible film from start to finish. I knew as it started it was going to be terrible but kept watching in the hope it would improve. It didn't! I think it was directed or written by someone who had a career in US soap operas.

Although it started promising,it got very predictable soon enough. I had to watch until the end as wanted to see how many movie cliché could incorporate.Bad plot,cheap conversations; very predictable scenes- more like a cheap budget movie.

Don't watch. Honestly, a fiction writer as a homicide investigation consultant? The killer wears size 11 shoes? A teacher by day, fantasy worker by night? A detective who can't control his urges to keep focused on the job. A controlling senator-mummy. A nasty ex. More cliches than there is omicron cases.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've seen
reviews.content:
I am really happy I didn't actually spend money on this movie. Malachi weir is one of the lone bright spots in the movie. I cannot tell if it's a murder mystery or comedy,
which is never a good thing.Alyssa Milano should stick to social activism bc she is no longer an a list actress. The acting across the board is horrific. It's often difficult to even take them seriously. Im not even sure if the cast itself believes the gravity of the plot.I usually like pretty much every movie, so I have a very low bar, but this movie is terrible.

We knew who was going to get killed and guessed who the killer was almost immediately. We literally said "They want us to think it's him, so it can't actually be him..." We were giving it way too much credit. It was entirely predictable, the dialogue was painful and I was genuinely surprised it was based on a book and not just written so Alyssa could wear the costume.
This is just bad. The dynamic between the sisters is cringey and hard to watch. Once she gets killed the movie picks up a TINY bit but still not worth it. Please don't waste your time.
Probably the worst acting I have ever seen. Once you get into the movie though, it is entertaining. Once you start watching it, you want to see the ending.

reviews.review_title: Too cliche for a film in 2022
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of crime, mysteries, & investigative shows, I saw this trending on Netflix so I immediately gave it a go.The plot was good, it has something interesting in it but the script writing is awful and the acting of the lead character was way off to a point she was annoying. I tried to gave it a bit more time but decided to stop watching with still 33 minutes left, it's just terrible and a waste of time.

Do you know those films on in the afternoon on Channel 5? (UK only)
You know....the ones where the lead protagonist is a succesful woman (in this case a writer) who is a mystery buff (think murder she wrote) or returning to her home town. A crime then happens close to home that only her interest in mysteries can resolve (again think murder she wrote).Well this is one of those films.You know the ones where the romantic lead is a 2 dimensional caricature of a man (freshly bathed twice a day) who wears plaid shirts and a great handyman. Usually a fireman who is building his own boat or a lumber jack who volunteers at a day care centre.....you know....a 'Brad'. A proper hero (I think I have been a bit sick in my mouth....sorry). It's one of those guys. In this case a respected cop building a house.Yes, one of them films.It's as predictable as a hangover on a Saturday and as gritty as Peppa pig eating marshmallows in tomato soup and as sick making as both of those things. Any sexual content that is implied in the title and cover picture is there for...well I don't know really. Please feel free to have a 'I've been cheated' expression if you were expecting any. There is none in the film. No swearing either. This is an afternoon matinee that had no surprises or plot twists.Oh yes as usual the 'Brad' hero turns up at the end after the (and I use this word wrongly) 'mystery' is solved and killer identified and pretty much captured by the heroine. I assume that is because the producers insist the heroine would need a cuddle at this point. As does the veiwing audience (yes that will mean you).
Mediocre movie with mediocre actors , simple scenario with the most predictable ending ever. I voted 1/10 stars and if i could vote 0 i would too. Im ashamed to have watched this awful movie tbh.

Will have you saying "as if" the entire movie, every situation and decision is so unrealistic, it would never happen in real life.The woman's an author, and every person she meets has read her books and praises her. The police let her lead the investigation into her sister's murder. We continued to watch the movie just because each twist and turn was worse than the one before.

reviews.review_title: Not the lifetime movie drivel I expected
reviews.content: It kinda looked like a Lifetime network drama. But Alyssa Milano did great. Finally, a movie where she can show her talent. Well done. I enjoyed this movie, because she is a great actress.

The story about the murder was okay, but there was too much weight on the love story between Ed and Grace and even this was not comprehensible.The focus should have been the crime and not the love story, when the genre says the movie is a thriller.The acting was also okay, but could also be better.

Wow, just wow! This just kept getting worse by the minute. The terrible acting, the script, the whole thing. I couldn't finish watching it. Really reminded me of those Hallmark movies you watch in a motel. Just awful. Don´t even bother.

This could have been interesting, except for the amateur police investigation and no surprise as to the killer's identity. Oh, and the fact that during a stake-out with Grace as bait to entice the killer, the detectives figured out his identity. So, off they go to his house to arrest him, removing all police presence where Grace was. Did they leave even one officer to protect her until the killer was in custody? Of course not! So of course he wasn't home when the police showed up, because he had doubled back to find Grace and kill her. Did he succeed or was Grace rescued? Nobody cares!
If you read the book, don't watch this movie. I tried really hard to not get distracted while watching this movie, but that took a great deal of effort. Not a reason for Netflix to raise fees!!
It felt like there were parts missing, maybe the book is better? It seems like the whole movie was just an excuse for Alyssa Milano to wear that ridiculous outfit at the end.
This movie is a steaming turd. Appalling in every way. Don't waste your time. And, don't let the fact it's a Netflix film sway you otherwise. Netflix should be ashamed of themselves.
This might be the worst film I've ever seen. Save yourself the anguish and don't watch it. The acting was almost as bad as the storyline, and that's saying something. Couldn't wait to turn it off.

reviews.review_title: How are there so many online dominatrix's in that town?
reviews.content: I can't get past the fact that some details don't make sense. And why is the poster looking like a love story? Could have been so much better if they had made it make sense.
The writing and the acting was pathetic and predictable. The plot was not very believable. And the police representations was dubious at best. Boring. Save yourself and watch something else.
